text: This was the worst food I've ever had. I ordered to-go and not only did they get my entire order wrong and the food was awful, they charged me double for it. Do not recommend!!!
Excellent selection of well prepared Sushi.  Nice atmosphere that is definitely a bit "Clubby" as somebody previously mentioned.

One of charlotte's must go restaurants for and great food. The owner/hostess will insure you have great experience with your friends. While they service you top notch sushi in a NY esque atmosphere. Always' a lively place on thud-sat.

Wow! Not only was the food off the charts but the atmosphere was perfect. I had the pleasure of meeting Joanna aka sushi mamma who sat down and ordered for our table. Joanna really has it figured out. The detail put into her food and the pride in her craft is unprecedented. Joanna, thank you for a wonderful experience. Lenny,baby joey,Jonny san,joker face,and Pett.
One of my all time favorites! Incredible atmosphere very upscale and beautiful restaurant.  Amazing sushi !

My first experience ever at Nikko's and it was awful! Coming into the restaurant I was greeted by the hostess, who wore a tube top; what kind of nice restaurant would let any worker where a tub top besides a club or a bar!! We eventually seated at around 6:45pm and order appetizers that didn't come out until an hour later when everyone in my party was starving. We didn't get refills on any of our beverages and when I order wine the waitress didn't asked for an ID. When we finally put in our entrees our food didn't come out until an hour afterwards; on top of that our food was cold by the time it got to our table. Everyone was upset and didn't even touch their meals. Even when I talked to the manager he raised his voice and couldn't comprehend what I was telling him, I already know sushi is cold! But my entree was not suppose to be!!  After that brief session the manager stormed off from our conversation and yelled JESUS. Very rude and unprofessional business. The ten people at my party will never come back again nor will they recommend this place to anyone else.

Delicious food. We had the gyoza dumpling appetizers--my fav of the night! We also ordered the tempura fondue, which had tempura sticks of lobster, scallops, shrimp, and vegetables with a yummy, warm cheese dipping sauce. We ordered the bagel deluxe and the dragonfly sushi rolls. Both were excellent, though I was partial to the bagel deluxe because it had that more authentic sushi taste. I got an extra dirty Absolut martini and it was spot on, though the glass was only filled 2/3rds of the way. :( We waited about 30 minutes for a table even though we had a reservation. We went on Friday night and the place was hopping--here was a live DJ, tons of young adults dressed nicely. I took a star off for the parking. We didn't know where to park. They had valet but I didn't want to pay extra for that. We ended up parking in a small strip mall's parking lot and walking about 7 minutes in 32 degree weather. Prepare to spend quite a bit--we spend $85 on 2 bar drinks, 1 app, 2 sushi rolls, and 1 entree.

Went here to celebrate my girlfriends 21st due to all the good reviews about this place and between ordering a appetizer of sushi to start off with and walking out the place it was nothing but a complete waste of time and money. The service was horrible unlike the reviews. The sushi took 40 min to arrive the entree another 30 and was cold when it did. The manager just made excuses of how it was busy at the time, that's doesn't explain why my foods cold does it? In the end I paid the $93 dollar sushi bill seeing how I didn't even bother touching the ice cube they called salmon and rice and we headed to cookout for a hamburger tray and a milkshake all under $10. If I could give no stars I would.
Great food...ok service, but the music was way too loud. We were yelling at the table just to try and talk. Make up your mind. Are you a dance club or a sushi bar?
The lobster and tuna roll were delicious! The vibe inside is fun and fresh... good place to get some drink before going out also.

I made a reservation at Nikko the past weekend through OpenTable, but when showed up at the restaurant, the lights were off and it was closed.  There was no mention of this on the restaurant's website and additionally I was able to book a reservation on OpenTable.com.  So there I was, with a date, at 7:00 pm with no where to eat- a GREAT experience for me and my date.  When I emailed the restaurant asking for an explanation, I was told that I must "have the wrong location."  Of course I was at the only location I know, in South End.  They placed blame on me rather than taking responsibility for being closed after I had made a reservation.    I can't comment on the quality of the food or atmosphere, but the management.... extremely poor in my opinion.

This place is my all time favorite go to sushi place! The food is AMAZING and the service is terrific! The atmosphere is fun, clean, and energetic. My husband actually introduced me to this place and it didn't disappoint. I highly recommend this place. It's my favorite sushi place in Charlotte.

I've been to lots of sushi restaurants, and I feel that this one is pretty great.  I haven't been to any other Charlotte sushi spots, though, so I can't compare locally.  This was one of the best sushi meals I've had in a long time. The vibe inside is very trendy, which I find fun.  We sat at the bar, so we could watch everything get made.  The sushi guys were happy to answer any questions we had ("Oooh, what's that?)".  The server made suggestions on what we should eat based on our likes and how hungry we were, and her suggestions were great.  It's pricey, but sushi can be that way unless you get a lower budget sushi, like at Ru San's.  I think it's worth it.  Will definitely be back.

Both of us ordered the $14 Tonkotsu Ramen.  Took 25 minutes for the food to arrive, and the soup was only lukewarm.  Not a good sign already.  Things only went downhill from here.  The noodles weren't Japanese ramen but more like the Korean variety (soft, not curly), and the broth was way too salty.  The pork was ok but the cold soup and wrong type of ramen had ruined it for me.  Seriously this was worse than frozen ramen from a Japanese grocery store.  I know they call themselves a sushi bar and Ramen may not be their specialty, but at this price point I had really expected a whole lot better and won't be returning.

I'm back to write a review for lunch! I love a good sushi or bento box lunch special. Nikko's sushi roll lunch special includes two rolls (not just the most basic, there are probably rolls to choose from) and a salad with their delicious ginger dressing (they claim it's the best ginger dressing in Charlotte, and it is pretty darn good!) for twelve bucks. Can't complain there! The restaurant is definitely quieter at lunchtime too, so it would be a good place for a business lunch or to have a long lunch with friends and actually be able to have a conversation. So now I can say I would recommend Nikko for lunch AND dinner.

I heard great things about this place and opted to go last night on date night with my wife.  We made reservations through opentable.com and showed up...only to find it was CLOSED on a Thursday night!  WT...  I really wish someone would communicate that.  Fail!
I have FINALLY found amazing sushi in Charlotte.  I moved from NYC/ NJ and have been dying to find quality sushi around! A little pricey, but what great sushi isn't?  I am a happy camper.

Best sushi in Charlotte, hands down.  If you've never been to Nikko, prepare yourself to pay accordingly.  Let's face it:  Pappy Van Winkle costs a hell of a lot more than Jim Beam but it tastes a hell of a lot better, too.  And so it goes with Nikko.  You can save money by eating at Sushi 101 but you won't experience the superior quality fish and preparation.    I'll admit it...it can be a bit of a surprise when the music suddenly becomes louder and Joanna comes out with her tambourine.  You know it's coming, you just don't know when.  Batten down the hatches and prepare yourself for it ahead of time.  Winning a saki bomb throwdown is not one of my finest restaurant moments, but I can mark it off the bucket list.  You should, too.  The atmosphere is extremely clubby and most of the patrons are, well, clubtastic.    So, now that you're prepared for the price, the dancing, the tambourine, the cowboy hat and the clientele, you need to prepare your mouth for the most delicious sashimi in town.  The uni is wonderful salty deliciousness.  The blue fin toro will melt in your mouth like butter.  And so on and so forth.  I only wish that I could get a bowl full of fried shrimp heads without having to order the sweet shrimp.  I just can't stomach those snotty little bastards.  Joanna!  Save up your shrimp heads for me so I can have a delicious bowl of them every time I visit!  Please!
Went on a girls night and it was excellent!! The atmosphere was very lively! If your looking for quiet ambiance then go before 6, after that there is a DJ! The food is great and very quick!

Absolutely horrible service. As someone who worked at a restaurant for numerous years, I am usually lenient and understanding. But the service was absolutely horrible. We waited 2 hours for our food. Once it came finally, we waited another hour for our checks (after asking for them immediately). After speaking with a manager, we had to finally go up to the register to check out (30 mins later). We left at midnight. No one ever came to apologize.

I would choose zero stars but there is not an option for that. My boyfriend made reservations for tonight at 8:30 and we are still standing by the bar at 9pm... The front desk host was rude and when asked what was what taking so long, he replied "I don't know why your still standing here.".. Then we were told the table next to the table we needed weren't getting up. Basically, they were not prepared for a large party that made a precious reservation...

If I could give it zero stars I would! Until Friday night Nikko was my favorite place to dine out in the Charlotte area. My kids knew it was "Mommy's favorite restaurant". We went here for birthdays, date nights and special occasions - never leaving with a bill under $300. In the past my friends and I got a kick out of the antics of Joanna the owner. However, Friday night I was appalled! She was obviously high on drugs! She started off repeating herself and not leaving our table after my husband and friends ordered Saki Bombs (she had 1 too - like she needed anything else to add to her buzz). Joanna then proceeded to pick several pieces of sushi off our platter, eat the fish off, spit out the rice - guess she's on a diet and watching her carbs - and put her 1/2 eaten saliva covered food back on our platter with our uneaten food. If this were not disgusting enough she ate 1/2 a piece of sushi and shoved the other half into my friends mouth!!! I was appalled to say the least and went to the hostess stand to get the manger. When I returned to the table she was hanging on my husband asking him "Why you married to such a bitch?" Carter, the manager, had Joanna removed from our table and hopefully sent home to sober up. We did not see her again that evening thank God! Our very embarrassed waitress and the manager handled the situation very well. Thank you to them. Joanna - thank you for ruining my birthday dinner! Thanks to you, I will be finding a new favorite restaurant!
This place was GREAT!  Food was amazing.  High quality service.  Cheap prices.  Large quantities.  Strong drinks.  Definitely a high recommendation.

My coworker came here and ordered Udon (pronounced oo-don) and had the "Japanese" waitress correct her say "you mean 'YOU'don?"    ONE STAR FOR POOR MANAGEMENT  It was all one big joke until I actually came here.  Now granted the food is mediocre, and some are even pretty decent but the management was TERRIBLE.  We had a large group come and we ordered TONS of food as evident by my 11 pictures (granted that's only a quarter of the table).  We had a few people that couldn't make it but with alcohol we definitely ran a decent tab.  At the end of the evening the staff came by and said we hadn't hit the minimum for the private room and we where going to have to pay the difference.  SERIOUSLY!?!  After much debate, the restaurant allowed they guys paying the tab to buy some additional alcohol to fill the tab.  But since everyone was from out of ton they had to have it shipped.  Guess what... IT NEVER ARRIVED!!!   Overall that really soured the experience.  The servers were going on about how fresh their fish was and how they would go the airport several times a day and even have clients who would fly in just to eat here. Sadly, When we had asked the them for recommendations, they asked us if we preferred fried or non fried.  We said non fried and they where like "um... then we don't really know what to recommend." LAME.  Anyway, on to the food.  We grabbed a few appetizers.  The presentation was nice like on the FLASH FRIED CALAMARI (Who comes up with these names?) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rZOzhSA5HP6IdpxuN4v66w?select=tSkv98cSBGdPwx2VbdTCIg  There was an order of SOFT SHELL SPRING ROLLS http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rZOzhSA5HP6IdpxuN4v66w?select=9Pi4Qm5nH__s4ai6kf1VMw  They were decent but the sauce was noxious.  Stand out dishes included OMEGA 3 - Seared salmon on one side, with avacodo and Masago mixed into the rice.  Topped with marinated onions and jalapenos this was actually pretty good and I'm not usually a fan of cooked salmon.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rZOzhSA5HP6IdpxuN4v66w?select=k6jiPToJ1zh8H39zbErOaA  SPICY TUNA NACHOS?  - Not sure if that's the right name.  Now granted it's hard to mess up spicy tuna, but this was decent. I recommended it to someone at the table who didn't really eat raw fish (you should usually recommend Spicy Tuna to sushi neophytes) and she really liked it. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rZOzhSA5HP6IdpxuN4v66w?select=9NWxQ7GiV32EYYi4qRIIGg  FIVE SPICE CHOCOLATE CAKE with GINGER ICE CREAM... http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rZOzhSA5HP6IdpxuN4v66w?select=P0P1mlC0FoMXdvExqadzTg Again, nice name but the not much more than a regular chocolate cake.     Overall, I might have stopped back her for the OMEGA 3 but given the TERRIBLE management and the week staff I probably won't ever be back.
terrible service, atmospher,  food, beyond overpriced!!!!  way too over-rated place!!!!    will never go back.....stay away folks!!!

It was around 8 on a saturday night so I understand that they were busy, but our service wasn't that good. First they were out of stock on several bottles of wine, we had to order 3 bottles of wine before they actually had one we wanted. some of us ordered salads and half of us didn't get them until we reminded the waitress. The sushi was ok, definitely not the best i ever had. I am all about trendy and young places but the atmosphere was a little much, I felt like Nikko was trying too hard to be hip. It was a bit too much of a nightclub atmosphere for a place to have dinner, they had a dj spinning while we were there and it was so loud that the only person you could talk to was the person next to you, and there was also a girl passed out in the women's bathroom with the door locked.  Good things: We had reservations and we were seated immediately and the cost was very reasonable. I paid around $45 (tip included) for a salad, sushi, and a half bottle of wine.

It is a good looking restaurant. We(10 people) went there yesterday for my birthday party but nobody was happy with the service.  The waitress(Alisha) was very rude from the beginning.  My girlfriend had to literally tell her to please mood up since it is my birthday. We sent back a couple of food as it wasn't what we asked for.   The check was around $700 so that mean we gave a lot of business on a Tuesday(very slow day). My friends didn't let me pay but today they told me that most of them were OVERCHARGED from what they signed for.   My friends and I are never going there again.  If you do want to go, please make sure you don't ask for waitress ALISHA.  You know they say "One rotten apple spoils the whole barrel", I think Alisha is like that, the place could be good but she spoiled it for us.
Sushi is still amazing!!! I love anytime I find rolls that aren't smothered in sauce and tempura flakes. Being able to enjoy the flavors was wonderful!!! Still one of my favorites.

No sushi love here anymore.  Everyone who lives in South End's pink building just got sued by Nikkos.  Boo!  https://www.charlotteagenda.com/45766/everyone-lives-south-ends-pink-building-just-got-sued/

This place has a great location and a great atmosphere. Everything is super over priced, But the food is delicious on that note. Our waiter was very adamant about serving us shots and would ask if we were ready for shots every time he came to the table. It had to have been at least 10 or so times which he asked us if we were ready for shots, Which nobody was there to get wasted. The server was friendly yet pushy and would not stop talking to us, Just wanted him to stop talking and let us eat the food we were paying top dollar for!

Let me start by saying that if you make a reservation, you are not reserving the right to a table before other patrons who are physically at the restaurant. Rather, you are reserving a time slot for two hours as per its policy. I have never heard of such thing until a group of friends and I made reservations for a party of 10 for six o`clock. In addition to having the majority of our group present and a pretty empty crowd, they denied our request to be seated until all 10 individuals arrived. Not to mention the fact that service was terrible from management and server, and they kicked us off so the next party who made a reservation could have the table. Ive been to various high end restaurants and have never been treated this way, and im not saying this is by any means high end. Will never go back to this place.

Sadly what looks like a a wannabe stylish Asian experience simply cannot deliver when it comes to the food and service  Edemane Beans that lacked salt, Miso soup that had the smallest amount of  tofu floating about barely qualifying it for the title, Ginger dressing on the salad was good. However the Chicken Terriyaki was straight off the Sysco truck having been pre-cooked in some commissary  in Ohio and then dosed with a little sauce and sesame seeds. .  My server had great difficulty in extracting himself from his deep discussion with the pretty bar tender, who was clearly enjoying the attention. When he finally did circle back and ask if everything was "Okay" I got to tell him how unhappy I was with the chicken.  To his credit he did offer to replace it, but after having waited for him to return to my table I had lost my appetite. The bill was presented with the chicken removed, but that was that, clearly management is comfortable ignoring a legitimate complaint not bothering to correct my perception of the restaurant.   I left the restaurant nobody offered a farewell or inquired about my visit. Oh the Parking Valet did that, and he just shrugged his shoulders at my response, as though he'd heard it before.

The thing about Nikko is that the atmosphere is great. Decor looks lovely and it's a vibrant space. Music is super loud though, but if you're in your young 20s looking for a place that opens late and is close enough to downtown that you can just jump right over to the club, Nikko is a good spot. But honestly, prices are too high for the quality of food you get. Sushi is okay at best and entrees aren't that great either. There's is nothing special about the food here.

Nikko's sushi is AMAZING! I've been here both at night and during lunch for the $12 lunch roll specials. Of course at night the place comes alive and is a perfect place to have a girls night out. The super crunch roll is amazing. Substitute the mayo for cream cheese.   Complaints: The parking deck is easy to find but is kind of tight getting in and out of.  One of my friends was trying out being a vegan for a month and the waiter we had wasn't well educated on the vegan options.      This is definitely one of Charlotte's most upscale restaurants for sushi. Expect a wait on weekend nights.
Food was pretty good...not the best by any means. Waitresses were super rude and the service was painfully slow. There are PLENTY of better places to dine in Charlotte.
Over the last holiday weekend my sister, my bf and I went to this restaurant. It was really good. Fresh sushi and hip atmosphere. When I'm in Charlotte, I'll be back for sure.
Great food and atmosphere. Fish was very fresh and they have a nice wine selection. Free Valet parking is a big plus! The restaurant was clean. Everyone working was very friendly.
Not impressed. Service was horrible and I found CHICKEN in my tofu dish. As a vegetarian, I was very upset over this and the staff/Joanna was rude when I pointed it out. NOT going back here again.

Oh I'm so torn.  I know CLT has a love affair with Nikko.  It wasn't that my experiences were bad...the place is fun... but...well, read on fair Yelpers, read on.   The prices, like Nicole W. said are a bit high.  I not only saw a $29 freaking dollar specialty sushi roll...but our $8 tempura appetizer was meager in size, and frankly, too salty and not light and crisp.  (RuSan's does the same average quality for a DOLLAR for 2 pieces!) This is not New York.  This is not Boston.  This is not the kind of sushi place where a $12 singular piece of sashimi is justified. The rolls *were* good...but again, the price was kind of a killjoy.   Perhaps I should back up, and talk about the parking.  Yes, there's free valet, but for those who don't want to valet...parking on the 4th floor is kind of irritating for Charlotte.   Go with the valet.   The atmosphere is total nightclub.  Modern lighting fixtures, bar, even the bathroom is fun/club-esque.  The high prices probably go toward paying the DJ.   Michael E. is right about the service-- it's good.  Example, a server we had on a recent outing with a big group, was attentive, and good at suggesting sake, specialty rolls and appetizers.   Maybe this place is good for the outgoing-loud-social set, but for the money, I'd go to one of the more solid sushi joints, and use the money you saved to go to a real club, if that's you're thing.

Nikkos is always a solid choice for sushi, but I am a more adventurous person when it comes to sushi rolls. They have great salmon sashimi, however it is 6$ for two pieces so it can get pricey really quickly. The place has decent service, but except a wait on Friday/Saturdays. They also have a DJ Friday and Saturday nights as well as free valet service so you don't have to try to navigate the parking garage.

I was looking for some sushi for dinner and this place was great. My entire meal consisted of sushi/shushimi and I can't wat to go back. There was free valet parking, and great service. There was a DJ and the music was LOUD.
OMG the Salmon Crunchy  Roll is a must order.  If a  lively up beat seen for a restaurant is what you are looking for, then this is the place.

I took my boss and her boss to dinner here. Food was AMAZING! You can order almost any sushi you can imagine. Drinks are made really well and with lots of love. Our waitress Vanessa was really on top of everything and very knowledgeable. I will be returning next time I'm in town.

Very good sushi. One of the best places in town.  It is bit overpriced. Atmosphere is very trendy, but we have been coming here for years, so we are used to it.  We get annoyed when the music is turned up way too loud. Can feel some tension between the owners- they are both on the floor overseeing the business. The woman owner is sweet, but acts like a star and thinks people come there to perform. Really, we don't...
The Firecracker Shrimp is my favorite thing in the menu. The only complaint I have is that sometimes service is slow.

I don't think you can go wrong with Nikko if you're looking for quality sushi.  1.  The food is outstanding.  A lot of different rolls available on their sushi menu and interesting specials every time I've been.  I haven't tried any of their teriyaki dishes or the bento box, but I've heard from others that both are great.  2.  The wait staff is great.  Have never had a problem with service.    3.  Good with large groups.  I've been to both the South Blvd. and Ballantyne location with groups of 12+ and never had a problem.  Checks were always separated appropriately and no orders were messed up.  The only recommendation I have is to make sure you make reservations (if you can, I'm not sure about this...).  I went with a date on a Thursday night and ended up with a 30 minute wait.

tried this place out on the recommendation of a friend. Service was awful, sushi was average. Not one single thing about the place struck me as better than any other sushi restaurant in town. Don't bother.

While visiting a friend in Charlotte we stopped here for dinner. She had been there several times for lunch and said the sushi was rather good.  I am a picky sushi eater since I don't like my fish to smell fishy (I know it is a quirk) and I must say it was fresh and tasty!  We had both ordered the bento box, chef's choice which included coconut shrimp with a tasty citrus cilantro flavor and not overpowering with the coconut, Kobe beef strips with mushrooms, 2 dumplings, and 9 slices of sashimi.  It came with a miso soup which was also delicious. Everything was just delicious including the lychee martini!    Would definitely recommend and am staying at 4 stars for price reasons only although I understand lunch is much more reasonable.

Absolutely great sushi, great service, great atmosphere and great saki!  The different varieties of sushi allowed me to find something new while find my favorites. The menu included close to 30 different kinds. The owner was entertaining as she danced with her cowboy hat and feather boa. The price was a bit steep, but worth it every once in awhile.  This is a great place to take a date (if you both enjoy sushi)!

This place is ok.  The ambiance is a huge turnoff.  It's a nightclub moonlighting as a sushi bar.  Anyone who doesn't want to be hangin out with yuppies and trendies needs to steer clear of this place.  Music feels like I should be at a Rave...probably has something to do with the lady in white snakeskin boots and matching 10-gallon hat at the hostess podium?  I'm assuming that's the owner...no self-respecting boss would let their employees get away with dressing like that at work.  I would not bring business colleagues or clients to this establishment...unless I was in the business of owning strip clubs (I'm not).  The fish is ok...overpriced for the cut and quality though.  Selection of rolls is the same...just ok.  Drinks are priced according to what one may experience in an Uptown fine dining restaurant...and this place falls short of that, in both quality and location.  This is definitley a place that prefers form over substance when it comes to a good sushi experience.  You are paying for the decor/ambiance...not decent sushi.  Service is always quick and attentive, no matter how busy.  After trying several dinners here, I only come here for their lunch now; the nightclub feel is just too off-putting...and I'm only 26 yrs. old!  I can handle a nightclub, just not with my fish.  the Bento lunch boxes are a decent deal.

If you visit Charlotte and stay in the downtown area, this is the sushi place to go. The sushi was mmm superb, I had a great time here. Perhaps because I went to visit my girl Brooke in Charlotte at the time. She was fantastic, definitely made it worth the trip. We drank too many martinis and made out in the elevator on our way back to the parking garage. Few people saw us as they got on and off the elevator but we didn't care, we just kept kissing and making out. Will never forget this night, it felt so fkin good!  5 stars based on what happened in the elevator

Meh. That's what I have to say about this place.  First, the location is close to my work so I was excited about that but the parking situation is terrible, just be ready to hunt for a while.  Second, I got chicken teriyaki with fried rice (extra charge which I was fine with) and miso soup. What I actually got was dry chicken (not overdone but dry as in not sauced) with teriyaki on the side and rice with almost a whole onion chopped in it. Onion is okay but this was just way too much - who really thought that much was a good idea?! As for the sauce, teriyaki is very think and rich until cooked so I really couldn't use the sauce. The soup was just okay so this experience was not great all the way around.  I think I'll probably try it again and remember these things so I can be very specific about how the food should be cooked. Not worth the price when they don't really measure up to any of the other hibachi places.  I didn't try any sushi but I will next time.
Great restaurant, Great food, Great service. The owner is awesome as well. She comes around to the tables on the weekends and dances with the customers.
Yum Yum Yum, this is one of my favorite Sushi spots. 2 thumbs up!!
Pretty good food overall.  Service was excellent!  The Asian Cowgirl looks like she stumbled out of a bad porno but she kicks ass.  If you've been, you know what I mean.

I ordered the Salmon with Gorgonzola Sauce for take out. I notice the bill and they've charged $1 for "to go". WHAT THE HELL! I've NEVER heard of anyone charging extra for a pick-up order. Even if it's a delivery, I can understand an extra charge. What was even more annoying was that the packaging was lousy, cheap Styrofoam!! Not even worth a dollar. Now for the entree itself. The cook (notice my use of the word cook, not chef) had to be blind. That's the only way the fish could have been so overcooked. It was like a hockey puck. DRY and BLACK. The menu claims that the entree has mushrooms and asparagus in it. Again, the blind cook probably just put double the amount of mushrooms instead. For a pricey $22, this was the worst entree I have had in Charlotte. Two thumbs down.

Alright well, I finally got a chance to try Nikko this weekend after hearing about it being the best sushi in Charlotte.  I have to say, I was too distracted by the club atmosphere going on around me to even worry about the quality of the food.  That's probably because despite having a reservation for 15 at 9 pm, we waited until almost 10:30 only to be seated at a make-shift table set up for 8.  I'm talking about a table scooted up to the end of the booth making it impossible for the table behind us to get out and if you were in the inside booth and have to pee,  you better be prepared to hold it.  Waiting that long for a table when a reservation was made almost three months ago is bulls&(#! That is one of my biggest restaurant pet peeves EVER.  The loud techno music by the in-house DJ was also a bit much, this place is definitely trying way to hard.  The food was good, that I can say.  The seafood fried rice had big pieces of crab, scallop, and shrimp, and the rice was perfectly cooked.  That was probably the only dish that had portions and taste that actually  fit the price.  Our service was excellent, which was much appreciated considering how busy she was.  The sushi was sushi....nothing special, but solid nonetheless.  If you are heading to Nikko, be sure to wear your club gear and you'll fit right in.  Oh and don't bother making a reservation, it's obviously pointless.

I've been here twice and both times the service was so awful that I'll never return. Both times were for birthday parties and both times we had to wait more than an hour for our food to come out. One time the owner even brought out sake bombs we never asked for and offered them up to everyone saying they were free for the party. At the end of the night, those "free" sake bombs were on the bill.

WARNING: Nikko is not suitable for vegetarians or vegans, and potentially others with food sensitivities. On my first visit, I ordered a vegetarian noodle dish. The waiter brought it out with chicken in it. No problem, mistakes happen. I let him know of the mix-up and he was very apologetic. About 2 minutes later, the waiter brought out the dish again. It was sans chicken, but otherwise looked eerily similar to the chicken-topped dish. I asked the waiter if the chefs had simply removed the chicken, instead of making a new dish, and let him know that I would become very ill in the former case. He confirmed that they had in fact merely removed the chicken. The kitchen made me a new dish, although by the time it arrived my companions had finished eating (and I was constantly paranoid that it wasn't safe to eat). I received little in the way of an apology and was charged full price despite the entire ordeal. I offer this as a warning to those with food sensitivities.  Such deceptive practices are dangerous and intolerable.

Great sushi! Big fan of soy paper over seaweed, but they must not use it regularly because the rolls would not stay together. The place smelled like fake tanner too, LOL. Or it could have been the last person to have sit at our table. Good prices, cool atmosphere, and good sushi!

Caught this place at the end of their day. Nice atmosphere and a good feel all-round. The music may have been a little loud considering the place was empty but 90s hip hop is so classic it kind of worked. Tried a few rolls including the Dancing Queen specialty roll. This restaurant is on their sushi game for sure and the rolls were excellent. In all this was a very good experience and would be four stars, but reaches five stars because the service was outstanding

I am only giving 2 stars bc the food was actually fairly good. Not good enough for me to ever go back tho.   To say the service was deplorable would be an understatement. Our server was unbelievably dumb. My friend asked him to "rattle off" the top sushi favorites amongst guests and he needed us to explain to him what "rattle off" means.   He didn't bring soups for some of the party until we reminded him when the meals arrived.   I ordered a "round" of drinks and he came back with only 2 not 4.   CO2 was out in soda gun and we told him yet all drinks continued to come with flat soda.   Overall pathetic excuse for a server who each time we asked for something or pointed out an error he rolled his eyes.

Been here before and it's been pretty good. The service tonight was horrible. Having worked in restaurants before I'm understand busy nights however tonight wasn't busy. Our server was so bad we said something to the manager but still our night was taken from an 8 to a 2

This was the first time I ate here.  Met a prospective candidate for lunch.  I gave it 3 stars for the following:  1.  The taste of the House Cucumber Roll was dominated by the cucumber, which probably explains the name.  I had to remove 2 wraps just to taste the Salmon and Tuna.  Priced too high considering you really couldn't taste the fish.  Also the Ponzu sauce was only placed on 1 of the 8 rolls.   2.  Tuna Crunch roll called for "lightly" Panko tuna, but the Panko was over done, taking away the taste of the tuna.    Fortunately, the Spider Roll turned out really good.  Considering the overall cost of lunch, with 2 out of the 3 orders below expectations, a 3-star rating was appropriate.  Without the Spider Roll, I would have likely rated a 2 to 2.5 for the experience.

So here's the deal as far as we're concerned. The food is really good! Great  sushi in creative forms. So tasty and fresh, though a little more expensive. Perhaps worth it.  BUT, at least one bartender is very short on pours. A martini glass should not be half full.  This has occurred on every visit with only weak excuses provided. We no longer  drink here. On one occasion, we walked to the hostess desk and asked for a table. I believe the owner asked us to wait while she found one. She became so engaged in conversation, she completely forgot us. We left.

It seems to be that either you love Nikkos or you hate it..I love it there. Yes the Sushi is a bit pricier then in other spots, but your paying for the atmosphere and decor. Yes its a bit pretentious, but its a great place to get dressed up and have some pretty great food. Also they seem to be the only place in town in which I have found Hana Awaka Saki.

The food was OK, but I really needed a quiet setting where I could have a conversation during a fine dine. The music was way to loud and I even requested to have it turned down. They did turn it down, but 5 minutes later it was blasting loud again. Too obnoxious for me and will not attend again.

Awesome date place!!!! I had a great experience at Nikko,my date and I were seated promptly and there is an awesome selection of sashimi, sushi rolls, and other dishes to choose from.   We had the hamachi sashimi with the jalapeno & tobiko, super crunchy roll, dancing queen, and a spicy tuna roll.  All were very fresh and tasty...yum!  The ambiance was modern with Asian twists.  We sat in a big cushy booth as sharing sushi and wine.  It was quiet enough to have a decent conversation without screaming.

I should start by saying the food isn't bad. It was actually quite tasty.   I'm giving them 3 stars for 2 reasons:  1. Price was a little high for the quality of the food. We ended up spending over $50 for 2 entrees and and appetizer. We each ordered the teriyaki chicken entree and as I mentioned earlier, it was good. We had the firecracker shrimp for an appetizer and that was delicious but a little over battered.   2. Atmosphere. The place feels like you walked into a some weird fusion between a high end night club where you might find pro athletes and musicians / some type of Asian mafia in the back room.   Staff seemed friendly enough and we didn't have to wait long at all for our food.   I should mention we did not try the sushi which seems to be the route we should have gone after reviewing others comments.

This was a long descent from favorite sushi joint to "never again".  I hate to leave negative reviews, but after being a loyal customer for years, even as the food and service declined, my recent visit will be my last.  The sushi quality was unacceptable, and the service was downright rude.  So sad to see service go down hill.  Oh well.  Glad there are plenty of other options.

We decided to make multiple sushi stops and Nikko was our first one.  We showed up about 7:30 and the place was in full swing.  You need to know that at night Nikko becomes a club scene.  Not really my scene, but I wouldn't dock them any points for it because that's who they are.  We sat at the sushi bar, which cut down some on the scene.  We ordered the VIP Roll, Omega 3 Roll, and a spicy scallop roll.  I don't think I can pick a favorite.  Each one was wonderful.  The sushi was fresh, the rolls were original, and it was all delicious.  So many unique items, such as jalapeno miso sauce, went into the rolls.    There are other rolls I would love to try.  Will have to return.

Went last night for resturant week ended up just getting sushi rolls. The Cowboy roll was one of the best sushi rolls I have ever had. My Martini was spot on and the service was top notch. Michael treated my friend and I very kindly. He was very attentive and kind. We both had a great experience. The only problem was the sushi was too good we both were so full we couldn't try dessert. Next time!

It has been more than a year since I went to Nikko's and the memory still haunts me. I don't have the words to describe how loud the music was. It completely dominated the meal to the point that I did not even attempt to communicate with those around me.  We ordered our food by pointing at the menu. No one pretended that the waitress would be able to hear. Even then I was wishing I could leave. My ears hurt before the food arrived. Badly. I couldn't eat. I think that the food tasted like ear pain, but maybe my memories are blurring together. Hours afterwards I could not carry a conversation face to face and I suspect that my hearing never completely recovered. It cannot be legal to have human beings working in this restaurant without ear protection. That I was obliged to pay for such treatment is frightening.  Highlight of the evening: walking home a drunk girl is beating her boyfriend with her shoe and screaming "I ain't no white trash!"

Before Nikko moved into its new, current location, I loved going there.  The sushi was some of the best I've ever had, and the atmosphere was fun and lively.  Recently, we finally went to the "new" Nikko in Dilworth for our anniversary.  All I can say is...WOW.  It was like a sushi nightclub.  I loved the new modern decor, despite now feeling a bit underdressed.  I felt like I was in a New York City restaurant/bar.    We waited about 45 min for a table on a busy Saturday night, but had a couple of pricey-yet-delicious martinis from the bar to keep us occupied.  Fortunately, now, too, they have a big waiting, comfortable waiting area (and bar) that they didn't have before.    We were finally sat and ordered five different rolls to share.  Each one was made with care, wonderfully presented, and melted in our mouths.  I could have eaten more and more 'til my tummy burst.    We'll definitely return...but I'll wear something a little more dressy next time!

BOOM BOOM POW, SHAKIN THAT THANG! Come to Nikko Thursday - Saturday after 8pm and there's a good chance you'll here your favorite club music being blasted throughout the place. There's probably a crazy owner shaking a tambourine around the tables. If you don't see her or know who she is, just go to the bathroom and see the banner size self portrait hanging on the wall...yep...   All that said, the place has GOOD sushi. Full menu with many options, but for me, the sushi is what makes this place. They don't take reservations unless your party is over 6, so be prepared to put your name on the list and wait 30 minutes give or take depending on the night. If you go earlier in the week, walking right in and sitting down is expected. If you're planning your first visit, I recommend going early in the week to make sure you don't get annoyed and get used to the surroundings. If you're looking for a good time with friends/family and/or folks visiting, go on the weekend to enjoy the scene and people watching. Great outdoor area too for those perfect nights.   For the food...it's usually the same. Jalapeno Hamachi app along with the special tuna app w/avacado. For rolls, go with the Tuna Cruchy...the citrus sauce it awesome. Godzilla roll and Alex roll will usually find their way to the table too!

This was the absolute worst I have experienced in Charlotte. Starting with the unwelcoming receptionist and the fact that individuals that put their name down AFTER us received seating before we did. Moving on to the table where the most disengaged waitress came to offer her piss poor service. She would circulate the area and tend to every table except ours. There was an issue with my order and this lady had the nerve to point and rudely respond "this is what you ordered!" After speaking with her and demanding the manager, he came over just as disengaged as she had. He offered no solution to the rude service. I was completely turned off by the service and subpar food and have no intention of ever returning.

Kalbi beef bbq short ribs are a must! They were delicious, definitely one of my favourites. Tender, seasoned Korean style, to perfection! Couldn't snap a photo in time they looked so good   Definitely my go to Japanese spot here in Charlotte. Couldn't try the sushi, but looked amazing, will be back for more!

It seems Im not alone in my findings of Nikko's the atmosphere is great!! Music is loud, its fun and gets you drinking, but unfortunately there isn't enough alcohol in the world to make they're food taste good!!   I sent my Black Cod back because it was Tuna...When it came out next time I got the Black Cod it was so fishy I couldn't take it so I didn't eat it. The server told the manager and they said that it was cooked perfectly and nothing was wrong with it and that I probably didn't know what i was ordering so it was my fault and they will not be taking it off the check.   Now from one of my other reviews I have dined at NOBU in NYC.  I know NIikko's will never be anywhere near as good as a place of this caliber so I know it's not fair to compare, but to prove I've had Black Cod before is an understatement because it was probably the most amazing Black Cod I will ever have. But no they are right I have no idea what it is and what it's suppose to taste like....  She should probably just keep her mouth closed and let others run a restaurant while she dances around in her hot pink Boa and call it a night!!

One of my absolute favorite weekend spots to go! I've only been on Saturday nights and it's always "club-like" in a way, which I really like! I'm not sure if it's only on the weekend, but they have a DJ who always plays the best music. The owner is also really friendly and dances with guests, which makes the atmosphere super fun!  I also really enjoy the food! The sushi is great, but my favorite is the Nabe Yaki Udon. Comes with egg, shrimp, and chicken, so good! I also had the chicken yaki soba which was good as well! Most of the menu is pretty pricey, but the noodles dishes are all decent prices.  Would definitely recommend for a fun night out!   I do recommend making a reservation, the wait can be long! There is a parking deck (free), right at the end of the street and a parking lot, so that shouldn't be an issue. One of my favorite places in Charlotte!

We went to Nikko's for the first time for a friends birthday this week and I have to say I was pretty impressed. It is a bit more upscale then some of the other trendy sushi joints around town, with an almost club like feel. Parking was easy as they had valet parking. Service was great and the food was wonderful. We started out with the toro tartare which to be honest wasnt the best toro Ive had but still pretty good. It did lack a little flavor for what you expect out of toro. The price was about $19 which I think is somewhat fair for a good amount of toro. Definately a bit more expensive than your usual appetizer though. The remaining entrees were fantastic. I got the a sushi/ sashimi sampler plate for $30. it game with 3 pieces each sashimi octopus, salmon, and tuna and 8 pieces of nigiri including, shrimp, tuna, hamachi, salmon. It was definately tastey and for the price they did give big cuts of sashimi. The only thing I wish was different was the double tuna and salmon they give. I would of liked to try different fish on the nigiri. One of our friends had the volcano roll. It  may have been the best volcano roll I have tried. I believe it was around $13, which for higher end place is not a bad deal. My soon to be mother in law is in town from Detroit and she will not touch any sushi so she got the steak and chicken teriyaki hibachi. The steak was delicous. It was cooked to perfection and had great flavors. The cost was about $25 dollars. Which I think is comparable to any other Japanese restaurant. I did get a couple bottles of sake. I prefer unfiltered cold sake usually and they had a couple of different selections. It was rather good. I did notice that some of there sake was a bit over priced. I have seen the same sake at other restaurants for a fraction of the price. I would say this place is almost five stars. I have not been there enough to try more of their sushi rolls yet. I will definately go back sometime and maybe this review will be updated.
Good vibe, good food. Too loud on weekend nights. Make a choice, nightclub or dinner.
Love to eat at Nikkos.  Very delicious sushi and atmosphere is perfect.  They need better parking but we always get valet anyways
Nothing bad about this place. It's fun. Upscale. Great food. Great people. Great customer service.

Very conveniently located to the place I was staying on overnight trip to Chatlotte. I like to sample a few things when traveling and had the Toro Toro sushi which I thought was great especially when the spiciness kicked in. I also tried the dinner with chicken that I got with miso soup, salad, chicken and fried rice.  A lot of food which I didn't finish but decent sampler. Rice was good.  Chicken had nice sauce but a bit dry. Good dish if u are hungry! It was very loud for being Saturday night so I imagine good for parties not necessarily weary travellers getting off a 5 hour flight. If I'm back here I would probably go back and just try more sushi.
Ru San's has nothing on the volume here...  Ear splitting crappy music, mediocre food and a half hour wait for gyoza.  One visit was more than enough.

Great atmosphere. Perfect sushi restaurant for after work drinks and a quick bite. The location on South Boulevard is nice and yet parking is still OK. The sushi is not cheap, but the quality and art of sushi is what you expect from a high end sushi restaurant. I am not an elitist so I prefer the cool atmosphere with the quality in the food. If it were more stuffy or "quite" I would not like Nikko as much.  Almost my fav spot in Charlotte, but definitely up there...

The food is so-so. Service is terrible. I gave this place several chances. Servers/waitresses couldn't careless about the customer experience. Not to mention the price is very pricy for the quality...

Some of the sushi rolls that are more affordable, are just up to par, nothing too special. The more expensive sushi rolls, seaweed salad, miso soup, are quite good. As per the drink menu, I highly recommend the lychee martini. I just expected more for the price I paid.
Delicious sushi, friendly and professional waitstaff, and great atmosphere. We went on a Monday night so it wasn't that busy. Will go again for sure!

I took my girlfriend here for a dinner date. It certainly is up-tempo and seems to be a trendy spot for those in their 20s and 30s, but on the other hand, it's not a loud restaurant where you can't hear your tablemate.  Service was somewhat sparse; our waitress only came around once in a while to refill our drinks, and it took a while for her to take our orders. This was on a busy Friday night, but I still think if a couple more people were on the wait staff they'd be able to provide faster service.  However, you'll quickly forget about the service once you try the food. We had the Yaki Ebi (basically Teriyaki Shrimp on skewers) for an appetizer. Not much food for the $7, but delicious. I ordered the Sushi/Sashimi Combo ($25, but a LOT of food) and she had the Crazy Roll ($8.25) and Scallop Roll ($6.5). You could tell how fresh everything was just by tasting it, and the way they present it also adds to the experience. Her Crazy Roll was served in a tall glass over a bed of lettuce. Everything was delicious. All in all, far better than anything I'd ever eaten at Sushi 101 (though pricier).  Overall: Excellent sushi-eating experience if you don't mind paying the price, and waiting for the service during peak hours.

Went for NYE, rolls were way over priced and average at that.  Great environment, average food.  None of them were anything special.  For a $200 sushi dinner, walking away unsatisfied does not make me ever want to go back.  bottom line:  save your money and go to another sushi place

An oldie, but goodie. There are few things that I don't want to mess with in life. Raw fish being one of them. Nikko has an endless roll on sushi and decent prices for a classy venue. Jennifer at the bar is super attentive and kind. Alone, on a date or with a group... this place really is a great venue with amazing food. They have FRESH good quality salmon! Big plus for me. I have heard they turn into a dance floor/DJ on the weekends, but have yet to experience that.

Have always LOVED this restaurant.....especially how fun it is on Friday nights. Made a reservation and brought a group there on my birthday, told the hostess on the phone it would be 15-20 people.   People started arriving, and I asked them to seat us. Was told they would not seat us until the WHOLE party had arrived. This place has a VERY small lobby/bar area....having like 12 people in it is pushing it.  Told the man at the host stand this....he just said "sorry".  So standing out in the lobby/bar area with a massive group of people is not very fun....while we are just standing there and staring at our empty table. Wasn't even like we could have sat at the bar and ordered some drinks....the bar was already full of patrons.  Pretty embarrassing.
Sadly, Nikko has closed their Ballantyne location.

We made a reservation 3 weeks in advance for a party of 20. They sat us in a room with a wall in the middle of the table, so we couldn't see half of our friends. Service was terrible, and we left after getting one weak drink. The management was unapologetic about the whole situation. We will not be going back.

Has a cool vibe with the music and DJ playing when I visited Saturday night. Would recommend having a reservation. Our wait was initially 1.5 hours until we were able to find seats at the sushi bar. For the price and wait food was ok. Recommend coming for the atmosphere.
Awesome rolls and food. Should be noted on Friday nights this place has a DJ and gets very very loud so don't go Friday nights if you are trying to talk to someone !

As a NYC resident, I've had some pretty amazing sushi - and I wasn't expecting anything overly amazing while visiting my BFF in Charlotte last week... but my god, Nikko's sushi was crazy good!  This place is just awesome.  Fun vibe, trendy, great music, special drink menu... I was told it turns into a club at night, but it was pretty empty by the time we left to go out - so I don't know about all that. The Ballantyne Roll and the Dancing Queen Roll (which is like a Mexican roll) may be 2 of the pricier options (on a very reasonable menu) - but seriously, do not miss out on them!   I'm kind of wanting to fly back to Charlotte right now just to have more.

I am very iffy with sushi places. Most of the time it doesn't sit well in my stomach. This place is so fresh and delicious every time I go I'm never disappointed. I love how the owner is always walking around making sure everyone is satisfied and having a good time and the food is good.  So many different things to try and everything I've had hasn't been bad. My favorite is the lychee martini, which I'm surprised not a lot of other sushi restaurants have.   Yes there is music on weekends, I've never been during the week, I find it fun. Always a good time.

This place is a serious party.  If you have a group and are looking to celebrate a special occasion (birthday/bachelorette) this is the place for you.  It's practically a club at dinner time, with a DJ and lights strobing.  This is not a place for a romantic evening or a family meal. You definitely come here for the ambiance.   My asian chicken salad was okay, but I've honestly made a better one at home.  Sadly, it also may or may not have made me sick? I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt.   The owner was fabulous, in her Chanel dress, feather boa, and cowboy hat.  We were celebrating a bachelorette weekend, and she grabbed the bride-to-be out of the booth and danced her around the restaurant.  We also had sake bombs and lots of drinks.  Service was good and kept the beverages flowing.  Most girls had sushi that I think they enjoyed.   Overall, food was okay, experience was a total blast and just perfect for our first night on our bachelorette weekend!

What a fun and stimulating sushi place to be with high energy hip-hop loud music and cool DJ as well as Joanna (the owner) with her boa and signature cowboy hat running the place! Sushi at Nikko never gets boring especially when Joanna is dancing next to your table saying hi and sushi love. I love coming to Nikko to meet and bring friends for fun and entertainment as well as for great sushi! We were lucky couple times with celebrities comging here. Had an opportunity to take pictures with Jeff Gordan and the band Journey...WOW! What some fun nights it was! Most celebrities and athletes that are in town usually frequent this place. The atmosphere and the energy were vibrant as well as the crowd. The decor is very modern and sleek. The price is in the high end but it is well worth it. If there's no celebrity, the good looking bartender Kevin is also nice to look at if you prefer to dine at a bar, but it can get pretty crowded. When craving for sushi and martini, I will return to satisfy my sushi love.

WATCH OUT!    Keep a close eye on your receipt and keep your signed receipt.  Case in point, I dined there with friends and we split the bill.  I gave money to my friend and they left the tip on their bill (large bill for the table).  The waitress mixed up the receipts and he signed mine and vice versa.  Nikko knows that they made the mistake but they will not fix it.  They want my friend that lives out the country to call them and pay them the money to fix the mistake.  Ridiculous! Food is overpriced and customer service stinks worse than a piece of sushi left in a hot car.  Nikko you have now lost a loyal customer and all of my friends...I will NEVER dine there again on principle that you refuse to make things right.    Instead of Nikko...I recommend Pisces Sushi in the metropolitan or Ru San's.  Try the tempura fried oreo's at Pisces...delicious!

I've been to Nikko's several times over the years, and have always had fun while enjoying the ambiance, the food and Nikko herself!  That's right,  most evenings Nikko is walking around in her black or white cowboy hat greeting (and sometimes dancing with) patrons and taking pictures.    As far as the food - if you love sushi this is probably a top 3 spot in CLT for sushi.  They've got a loong sushi bar w/several chefs creating a variety of unique and classic sushi options.  I usually run one or two of their daily sushi roll specials.  They also have your classic hibachi/stir-fry/teriyaki-style selections served with steamed veggies and rice - try the salmon.   Service is usually straight here, although I wouldn't say spectacular.  For example, they don't hide the fact that they are closing in 45min and want you to leave - hehe.  Regardless of how busy they are, food always seems to come out in a timely manner and just as you ordered it.  My one complaint is sometimes this place lacks a bit of couth.  I am all for a DJ on Friday & Saturday nights - but does it have to be so extremely loud you can't carry on a convo w/ the person next to you?  If you are looking for a laid-back, quiet experience this is NOT the place.  Complimentary valet parking.   The food is always exceptional.  The service is good.  The ambiance is modern, hip and trendy.  I will def be back,  but could you just turn the music down a bit though?

I love Nikkos!! Joanna is so much fun and always keep the place upbeat and festive. Sushi is incredible and always fresh. I find the prices are a bit high, but really the atmosphere is what keeps you coming back. There is a Dj on the weekends and celebrating a birthday or anniversary is always welcome. Sometimes there is a birthday surprise that will be delivered to your table. I recommend sitting at the sushi bar, the chefs will custom make you rolls and give you tips on what to try!
Great rolls. Really loved my sushi. First place i tried in charlotte was terrible. Nikko redeemed charlottes sushi for me!
Cool atmosphere but the hostess and owner(look for woman on cowboy hat) were both unnecessarily snooty to our group of 30 something nice looking crowd.  Will not be back.

A large group of friends went to Nikko on Saturday for a friend's birthday.  They did a great job accommodating us, especially since we had such a large group and it was a Saturday night.  I tend to get really overwhelmed when ordering sushi for a number of reasons. First off, there's so many options. Secondly, I know what I like, but always want to try something new. Thirdly, I either order way too much food or not enough.  Saturday's decisions were made mainly off of the name. Sounds ridiculous, right? I ordered the Dancing Queen and Drunken Salmon.  The Dancing Queen is "steamed asparagus and spicy tuna topped with spicy guacamole and tempura chips".  It was delicious.  I will give this roll credit (or blame?) for morphing me into a dancing queen later on in the evening.  The Drunken Salmon was very light and described as "salmon toro marinated in Grand Marnier sauce topped with radish sprout with a side of creamy jalapeno sauce.  I loved that the creamy sauce came on the side rather than being drizzled over the salmon.  The sauce was great, but it was good to be able to control how much of it was used.    There's always such a great energy and vibe going on in Nikko.  Good music, good people and great staff.

We went here for a dinner for two. The food was good - try the bean ice cream, was great! The scenery looks cool but hard to enjoy as the music was super loud - not that many matrons were there so that might have affected the noise. Don't think we will be going back

Wasted $92 on dinner smh... an hour for food for a party of 20. Never got updated on food wait time, only got refilled drinks once. Servers seemed lost & confused with our table orders. Cold food. Just terrible.

Great sushi, fun environment. The fish is always fresh and the sushi rice is done right. Come here if you're looking for a fun dinner with friends before a night out on the town.  Sake Bombs for everyone!

Everytime I'm on break from college, I come here to get their sushi. It's that good. I've been told by relatives who've worked here that fish is flown in twice a week so the fish quality is top notch. I tend to favor the cucumber specialty roll and the spicy tuna handroll. The cucumber roll is heavenly due to the presence of shiso and the spicy tuna blend here  is the best I've ever had from any sushi restaurant.  While the sushi is good, the kitchen items are subpar for the price. You can get much better Japanese dishes at other restaurants for less. Out of the dishes I've tried, I've only like the bulgogi which I'm not sure is on the menu anymore.    I can't say much about service since I do primarily takeout but takeout has always been quick and efficient.

Took out of town friends to nikko's last night for dinner. Not a good experience at all. New server who didn't know the food nor the drink menus. Two friend for the teriyaki shrimp and chicken. Both WAY over cooked. Like jerky.  I've eaten at nikko's several time in the past and I have had great experiences. Maybe this was an off night?

I love Nikkos!!! Been going here since it was in the small venue across the parking lot!  This place by FAR has the best sushi!  The chefs are amazing and the owner Joanna is always there ready to keep the energy lively.  If you want cheap smelly raw fish then please go elsewhere.  You get what you pay for here! SUSHI LOVE!

My boyfriend and I came multiple times and each time it was better than the last! Yes it's loud yes it's crowded most times. But, it's definitely worth the wait. The service is great and the food is even better! I definitely reccomend to come for date night or night our with the girls! No kids at night because it does get pretty loud. Other than that. Great experience! I'd definitely come again.

Ok, let's start off by saying everything everyone said about it being a club, uber-hip style atmosphere is absolutely correct.  Now onto the sushi.  The first time I went there was phenomenal.  But that could be because all I the sushi I had recently was from 2 terrible sushi places :P.  The 2nd time was just "good."  The 3rd time was solid, better than the 2nd, and not as good as the first.  That being said it seems almost hit or miss.  I'll keep going back until I find a better place.
Wow. Service sucked a lot. We waited over an hour for our food then got the wrong order. Never got the food we ordered. Lots of large groups. Wait staff and management did not care.

Great location on the south end to have dinner with some friends or as a date. Place had various drinks to order and food to eat. A little overpriced but well worth. Customer service is on point and best to reserve in advance for a party larger than 5. Environment well lit and clean. More modernized than most asian restaurants.

The restaurant's got a pretty hip atmosphere when you walk in.  The decor is very stylish and club-like.  The service is pretty attentive.  However, the food is another story.  Maybe I'm used to good Japanese food, but this place does not pass muster.  We ordered a variety of sushi, as well as udon and teriyaki dishes.  I think they try too hard to be all things to all people in having such an extensive menu.  The result is that everything is mediocre and doesn't warrant the price, IMHO.  Our server even had trouble pronouncing some of the dishes, like "nigiri" sushi.

Checked out Nikkos for the first time last night, to celebrate some close friends birthdays. We were pleasantly surprised upon arrival to find that they offer complimentary valet parking- fantastic!   We had a larger group (13) and made reservations, but most of our guests were caught in Hornets game traffic. We had to wait till 80% of our party arrived to be seated, which was fine. We had plenty of time to have a drink and enjoy the scenery. The restaurant in itself is extremely swanky and upscale. It was much larger than I had anticipated, and the decor was top notch. Apparently on Friday & Saturday nights that have a DJ, so there was almost a "club vibe" going on. Perfect for my rowdy group of friends! The host staff was slightly snippy, however we were late so I can't blame them.  We were seated once our entire group arrived, at a large table near the back. Since it's Queen's Feast week, the whole place was very full. I browsed the QF menu, but since we had a night of drinking planned I decided to save some space for the liquids :) Our table was set up without enough menus for everyone, which I assumed was probably because they were so busy.   I chose to stick with beer, but many of my friends had cocktails & were impressed. For dinner, I had the chicken fried rice. This was fine, slightly drier than I expected but nothing that a little soy sauce couldn't fix. Everyone that ordered sushi enjoyed their meals immensely. The only negative part was that it probably took 30 minutes for all of us to receive our meals. They would bring one plate out at a time. Most of us work in the service industry so it wasn't a huge deal. The service was great, the staff kept our drinks full & processed our payments quickly. The quirky owner, Joanna, came over with her tambourine & danced right along with us.   Overall, quite enjoyable.

A little pricier than Ru San's, Nikko has great sushi.  The spicy tuna is excellent, and the ginger salad, with mixed greens instead of head lettuce, is a nice size.  There's even some entertainment when Joanna puts on her cowboy hat and dances on the bar...but you'll have to see that for yourself.

My favorite sushi place in Charlotte. The new space is much less quaint than the original Uptown location, but it's much larger and cosmopolitan. I moved from Washington, DC; going to Nikko makes me feel like I'm in a larger, more trendy city (sorry Charlotte, I like ya but you're still a small town on the rise). They recently added some outdoor dining space which seems to be used for lounging and private parties.

It has only taken me 3 years to try this place. Ever since I've moved here I've heard stories, good and no-so-much, and finally I had to try it out for myself. I happened to be in the area but not so sure I would have made the special trip.   You have to park in the garage, 4th floor, or do valet. They make you work for entrance and you have to really want their sushi.   The sushi and entrees were good and pricey and the service was just okay. I didn't come after 8pm, so apparently I missed the "show." However, I wasn't too disappointed in missing the club music or sake bomb encouraging owner.   Now I can check this place off my list. I love sushi and this one filled my craving.

I hate this place. Friends had raved and raved about it, but I did not see what was so great about it when I finally went with a couple of friends. Bizzare modern decor, overdressed severs, hostesses, and clientele, food is good but overshadowed by the trying-too-hard NYC atmosphere (but there are TVs set to sports channels..?). We are in CHARLOTTE. Are you kidding me? Get over yourself! Prices are also overkill. I loved the sushi over at Dean and Deluca Wine Bar in Southpark (unexpected I know) but I think the sushi chef moved to Rooster's last I heard. HIs name is Cy, he is the best sushi chef in Char. So I would recommend you go...elsewhere, not here.  P.S. The best part of this restaurant is it's in the hated, heinous "Pink Building" on South Blvd.

I've been meaning to do a review of this place since last November when I went out to Charlotte to visit my cousin.  Great place...I really liked the decor; waterfalls in the front.  Lighting was nice..ambiance was fancy and comfortable.  Very mod and chic, if you're into that kinda thing.  I had a roll there that was one of the top 3 rolls I've ever had.  I think it was called the Orgasm.  Haha ok it wasn't called that but it was good.  Some crunchy salmon something or other with sprinkles of mmm-mmm a side order of YUM.  Very tasty food overall.    I guess one of the drawback is the pricing given it is on the expensive side.  But honestly I'm willing to throw down a few extra bucks with the right combination of service, decor and good food.  Keep in mind I'm coming from the Southern California region...I'd probably be first to admit if this wasn't worth it.    Overall had a good experience...maybe I was riding off the holidays and being in a new town but I enjoyed myself.  Try it out when you want a treat.

Paul's Yelp Elite Rating: Solid 4 Stars!  Popped my Nikko cherry today.....YEAY! Went to celebrate my dear friend Tammy's XXth birthday today, and since she loves all things sushi, as do I AND haven't been here before, I said what the hell! Lock the cat in and jump in the car!  First off, it really is nice in here! Ultra modern with gorgeous liquor and sushi bars, with a warm blue light eminating from underneath. We got there at 630pm and it was D E A D. Not as in "The Walking..." but just DEAD. Must be the Holiday weekend cuz 630pm is NOT THAT EARLY, is it? Maybe I'm just getting old....??? Uggggggggggg..  Discovered that Thursday is HALF PRICE COCKTAIL night! Woo Hoo! Had 4 for the price of 2. Can't beat that. Oh, and they were really good!  Started with the Kukuni appetizer, which is a 10 hour slow braised PORK BELLY! That sweet soy sauce (typically called "kecap manis") used as the marinade was divine....PORK BELLY! It was very delicious!  Instead of painstakingly describe each of the dishes we ordered, I'm just going to summarize: Had the Korean Style Kalbi Style BBQ Beef Ribs which had sweet marinade that was slightly "burned" on the grill and that flavor was DIVINE! Our favorite dish of the night. Ordered 2 rolls: The Dancing Queen (an unusal asparagus roll topped with spicy guacamole and The Cowboy Roll, which had shrimp tempura, spicy tuna and avocado, topped with Kobe steak and garlic olive oil sauce. Both were really good (just not SUSHI GURU good - that's my story and I'm sticking to it).  Had to finish off this belly stuffing dinner with their Banana Fritter, which was tempura bananas with an orange honey dipping sauce and ginger ice cream. Our waitress was kind enough to put a little candle in the ice cream for Tammy's birthday, which was a nice touch! BUT, kind gestures aside, this was the weakest component of our meal (IMHO). While not bad, the "tempura" was bready and not crispy as you'd expect tempura to be. In addition, the amazing SOUNDING orange honey dipping sauce was quite watery and had very little viscosity....not quite a "sauce" in Chez Paul's opinion. The ginger ice cream was decent, but the overall dessert was average to below average....thus losing the extra star.  Really glad we came for sure. As other Yelpers have stated, this is NOT the cheapest Sushi place in town. It's quite a bit more than my standard bearer Sushi Guru and not quite as good - in my opinion. And the longer we sat the louder it got....definitely a "techno-bar" atmosphere which is OK with me since that's my favorite kind of music, but I can see how that MAY be annoying to those not into that genre of music.  Definitely recommended!

My friends and were planning a girls weekend and I made reservations for 12 at Nikko's a month and a half ago. We ended up needing to push our reservation back and they were very accommodating. Get to the restaurant at 8:45 pm (reservation was at 9), I checked in with the guy at the front and told him we were early, but wanted to check in. He said it would be a few minutes. I told him that was fine as we were 15 minutes early. Five after 9 and they haven't called my name. My friends goes to check and is told 10 minutes. 10 minutes comes and goes, we go check again. We are told that the table they are going to give to us is still seated (they have already paid, but haven't gotten up). About 9:30 I go to follow up again and I'm told the same thing. At this point I'm thinking 1. Either let the table know hey we are extremely crowded tonight and have a long wait, so that they can wrap up their conversation or 2. stop seating these parties of 3 or 4 people who are just walking and start pushing tables together, to accommodate the multiple parties you have waiting . The guy at the front says I can get you a drink on me, well sir there are 11 people in my party and it's not really fair for me to be the only one to get something and not everyone who is waiting, I said what about the rest of my party. He just looked at me and squeezed my arm. At this point I notice that there is another customer who keeps going to the hostess stand as well. I went to ask him what time was his reservation and he tells me his was at 9 for a party of 10 and he keeps getting the same run around. Finally get seated about 9:45 (45 minutes later), get to the table and there aren't enough menus, so we are sharing menus, its another 10 minutes before the waiter actually gets to our table. He finally comes, brings us water, takes our orders. Food comes out and it's even more problems. My friend sitting across from me  ordered one of the same sushi rolls I did but she asked for no mayo. He brings the plate out with my other sushi roll on it, but no mayo on the roll we had a like. He goes did you all switch seats, I said no we didn't. He goes oh ok I'll fix this. I said well just have the roll prepared with everything and I'll just take my other roll from her when it comes out. He brings back the roll still with no mayo. One of my friends asked for the tempura app and got the tempura roll. Another friend wanted shrimp with veggies and got the tempura roll. She told him that wasn't what she asked for, and explained what she wanted. He came back with tempura shrimp and veggies (Still not what she wanted). When the checks came, we were all ready to pay and had our cards/money ready. It took about 20 minutes for him to cash us out. When he came back with our cards and receipts he had the nerve to say gratuity was already included and if we wanted to add extra we could. We could clearly see that gratuity was included when we looked at our bill the first time, and his service nor the service we received at the restaurant was worth what was included, so to basically ask for extra  was an insult. The manager,  nor the owner (who was in the restaurant) apologized for our 45 minute wait or the multiple mix ups that happened with our food. The best part of the night was the live DJ they had.  I will not be going back nor recommending this place to anyone else.

Food came out really fast! That's a good thing for most people but I wanted to enjoy my Saturday night in hopes to listen to the music starting around 8.  Soup salad and edamame came out within minutes.  That's a great thing. Sushi came out quickly after which is awesome. I asked our sweet attentive waitress twice that I wanted it spread out time wise but that's ok  Food was amazing. Volcano roll and Cowboy roll then scallop app at end to keep us there a little longer.  Free valet parking a plus!!! Got there right at 7pm and gone by 8pm.

I really hope that Yelp starts the 1/2 star concept coz I want to give Nikkos a 3 1/2 stars. Nikkos looks likes a Sushi joint transplant from NYC. Its a bit odd that the owner dances around with her tambourine...but I guess thats entertainment? I wont lie, this place is expensive but the special rolls are pretty damn good. Their Dancing queen rolls and mexican rolls are yum. We take our guests out to Nikkos coz its fun place to get some sushi and pre game before heading out for the night. It not really a every weekend kinda place; why.....because I dont want to deck out to eat sushi and pay an arm and a leg every time I have a sushi craving.
Amazing sushi. Go in the evening for the happy hour and the owner will dance for the whole restaurant. It is strange, but entertaining.

Club Nikko!!! I came here (Saturday at 8:30pm) with a group of 9 to start our night out to celebrate my birthday. We made a reservation in-advance and we were seated upon arrival. The atmosphere was very modern (I felt like I was in NyC) and the music was poppin. They even had a DJ! Our friends told us in advance about the DJ and loud music so we thought this would be the perfect dinner and drink spot before going out. We even joked later when we went dancing that the music at Nikko was better than the DJ on the dance floor. I guess they have a live DH every Saturday starting at 8.   This place was also packed with birthday, graduation and bachelorette parties-some tables were holding 20+ people so this is a great place for large parties. I recommend making a reservation.   We all started with appetizers and my husband and I got the calamari. The calamari was basic (deep fried), but placed on a bed of lettuce with a spicy Thai sauce. It was tasty. For dinner we all got sushi, but they did have other options including hibachi. The mango tango roll was my favorite roll and it was HUGE! I would get it again.  For drinks I got the cucumber martini, which was on point! Very refreshing.   The owner was also very entertaining as she would jump from table to table and mingle with everyone. You could tell she enjoyed her job.   Overall great time at Nikko and will definitely be back before a night out! Oh and if it's your birthday make sure you tell them ;-) you will get a "surprise" treat.

Dined in with my boyfriend tonight. Interior of this restaurant is very posh and upscale looking. It gives off a really nice atmosphere. Perfect for date nights! We came in around 6 PM on a Saturday night and it wasn't too busy yet. But my boyfriend says how it's typically pretty busy on the weekends. In fact, on our way out, we noticed a DJ booth set up in the corner towards the front of the restaurant where the host stands were at.   Our server was Jackie tonight.
