She was so sweet and catered to all of our needs. She was on point with everything! She definitely gets 5 stars.   However, the food gets 4 stars. No complaints about wait time-- All of our food came out promptly. We ordered the sashimi deluxe and calamari as our appetizer. Sashimi was fresh. Calamari had a funny odor it gave off, but it didn't taste bad. It's topped with sweet and sour sauce that I didn't care too much for. We also got a salad that came with this delicious dressing and miso soup that was super flavorful. As for our entrées, my boyfriend got the filet mignon and lobster dish and I ordered the shrimp, scallops, and lobsters dish. In my opinion, it was a tad bit too salty. And I love all things salty!! Or maybe my taste buds were off tonight. I tried my boyfriend's filet mignon, and I'm not a meat/beef person AT ALL but it was pretty soft! I can now see how people say how certain types of steaks can just melt in your mouth. Finished our meal off with red bean tempura ice cream. Pretty good! Overall, it was pretty good here! Will come again. Thanks again, Jackie!

Terrible hosting service!  Wife and I waited almost an hour and a half, watched several couples walk in without reservations and get accommodated with seats at the sushi bar, while we stared at an empty high top table that wasn't even offered to us after several conversations telling us it would just be "a little bit longer".  Unless you look like you belong in South Beach expect terrible service.

This is a great sushi spot, however there are some things it could improve on. Free valet is always a nice plus, since the parking looked pretty hard to find a spot. First walk in and I felt a bit too casual for a sushi restaurant. It's a very modern feel, and everyone seemed to be wearing suits, probably shouldn't have worried too much though since later on in the evening the music suddenly pumped straight up and the owner came out in a feather boa and tambourine doing sake bombs!  The food was very hit or miss for me, not to mention kind of overpriced for what you get. The nigiri sushi and rolls are very fresh and innovative. The nigiri was a little big for my mouth though. The beef sukiyaki I ordered was hideously sweet. Almost felt like I was eating a dessert. I ended up not touching much of it, so I was still quite hungry and ended up eating off everyone else's plates. The udon and other beef dishes I tried from my company were fine though, so maybe I just had a messed up meal. However they did not ask at all if I liked my sukiyaki at all and that is not all right at all considering how much I paid for it!  It was a pretty good meal that I bummed off everyone else, the service is good, the problem is everything just seems good not great. The sushi here bumps this up another star. I think next time I will just make a meal out of only sushi here, it's that good!

The food here is amazing. I wish it was more affordable because I would come more often! I'd describe this place as somewhat upscale, very trendy and great for late night. The drinks are goooood but pricey. I love Korean beef and it is sooo delicious here. The sushi is always good too and now I want to go back...bye.

Best Sushi in town hands down.  Good luck eating there on a Friday Night without waiting 30+ minutes though.  Try the crazy rolls in a margarita glass. I will say you're bill will rack up quickly if you are hungry and drown a Saki bomb or two.  Est on a sushi meal is $15-21 + drinks  Also keep in mind that the sushi is made to order. So, you will have to wait but the owner is wild and crazy and will help pass the time.

This restaurant was absolutely beautiful inside!!!   FOOD- teriyaki salmon with rice and miso soup. PERFECT SALMON WAS COOK MEDIUM!! It's was not dry, cooked just right!! The was not a small piece either. The fried Rice's was yummy and I love the miso soup!! I should have gotten a big vowel of it lol.   INSIDE- BEAUTIFUL low lighting. The blue wall light by the bar was beautiful! The have a private room for party. And also fire pit outside.

I got love for Nikkos. Used to go during my lunch a few times but never went on the weekend. It's like a party in that joint. Loud music, everybody having a good time, plenty of TVs so you can watch the playoffs which was on last night and of course good sushi. I gotta hit this spot up more often.

When I worked in South End, this used to be the place my coworkers and I would go to when we wanted sushi for lunch. Prices were reasonable and food always excellent.  If you do go for lunch, I would suggest walking there if possible. Otherwise, you have to park on the 3rd or 4th level, then take an elevator to the first floor.   Side note: They must do excellent dinner/weekend business because that place was always nearly empty when I went at lunch.
The scene is nice here and the sushi is good.  Lots of energy here.

Best sushi in Charlotte.  Thursday -Saturday always busy but large to accommodate quickly.   The menu on the Specials page are all creations of the amazing owner Joana, and she will make your event fun as well as tasty.

This is a perfect sushi restaurant for a business lunch or wild and crazy birthday dinner. You can sit at the sushi bar or at regular tables and booths. You can stick to pretty traditional fare like a California roll, or venture to try something more exciting like squid or salmon. I love, love, love their Gyoza ( a delicious dumpling you have to try or you haven't lived yet) and the Stained Glass martini, which combines amaretto and midori among other liqueurs and somehow tastes fantastic! You haven't gone to Nikko's unless you have gone for a celebration of some type and ordered Saki bombs, because this is when Nikko herself, clad in an outrageous outfit of some sort topped with a cowboy hat comes out with a musical flourish and does shots with your entire table. Usually she has a tambourine which she insists on keeping time on your bottom or hers. From the art and design just in the bathrooms, to the club thumping beats the dj drops on the weekend, it's a blast and I will continue to keep going.

I gotta say my boyfriend and I were very impressed by the food!  Sushi was to die for!   We certainly had great service liked the ambience of the place. We ordered the volcano roll which packs allot of flavor I didn't want it to end lol! Definitely get the cowboy roll the Kobe beef with sushi I was in love with the favors. Last we had the Godzilla roll which also had a great taste. We have gone to some sushi places that are good but not crazy about it. But Nikkos we will def be coming back for sure. I highly recommend this place to anyone that wants high quality flavorful sushi.

Disappointed. The staff was rude upon arrival. The host clearly was having a bad day or lacked people skills all together. We also waited 10 minutes to be greeted by a server, as everyone one of them walked past us the whole time. We where just about to leave before greeted. Food wasn't good either. Spending what we did for a table of two I expected more. It's sad because we come to charlotte all the time. We Ate here once before and it was perfect.
A great place for a business dinner when you want to impress friends from out of town or a nice dinner out with the wife! Great sushi, the best edamame I've had.

Yikes! I had to bump my review down to 3 stars from the coveted 5.  I went to Nikko earlier this week on a friend date and I was so excited!  Well, I left feeling very disappointed.  I ordered my usual Shiitake Mushrooms appetizer and I was quite pleased although the portion was noticeably smaller than previous orders.  I decided to order the Rainbow Roll which for those of you who are not sushi addicts like myself, it is a roll that is topped with different types of fish and avocado which makes a beautiful rainbow presentation.  This is usually a more expensive roll but quite tasty!  When the server brought over my sushi, I could not believe how small it was.  Each roll was maybe a little bigger than the size of a quarter.  Also, out of the 8 pieces 4 of them were completely covered in avocado.  So half my roll had no fish on it.  Worse yet, the avocado was brown in several spots which means it was a little too old!  I let the server know that I was disappointed and pointed out the the avocado was brown in several areas.  She said she would have it "re-made" for me.  Well, when she brought it back, it was literally the same exact roll but the chef had sliced the brown avocado into smaller pieces and laid them on their side.  I almost couldn't believe they gave me the same exact roll and didn't at least give me fresh avocado!  Additionally, the server never asked me if it was better or checked to make sure everything was OK after that.  Can't say I left feeling impressed!

I went to Nikko for a work lunch event with a group of 8. We didn't have a reservation or anything (don't know if they take them for lunch) but we were sat immediately, and our waitron was out within a minute or two. The service was great throughout. Always quick drink refills, knowledgeable answers to questions, and generally joking and friendly.   I am certainly do not claim to be a sushi connoisseur, but I really enjoyed the couple of rolls I ordered. I went kind of vanilla on one, just getting a bagel roll, but what blew me away was the Volcano Roll. To quote the menu, "A shrimp tempura roll topped with Dynamite mix (scallops, crab, & octopus) topped with a baked spicy aioli sauce". Yum. A great amount of spice but every single flavor still came out. Some may call it complex, I just say delicious.   Nikko is also in a very good location for South Enders to walk to, and apparently things can get bumping in the evenings after the dinner crowd is winding down. I hear the lights go down and they start pumping club music and distributing Sake Bombs. Had to save those for another day though...

So me and my bestie from out of town decided to go to Nikko on a early Saturday afternoon, when we arrive the place was dead! with maybe 2 tables occupied. We go to front desk to be seated, the guy runs over and pretend to look in the system, I thought he was trying to find us a good seat, but he looks up and tells me that they have a lot of reservations and we can sit at the bar!! Ok so this place is gonna be packed with every seat reserved soon?? The place straight dead!! I absolutely feel like me and my friend was discriminated against!! I told him NO, and we hike our butts to Rai Lay a Block down and had the best sushi and service. I would never go to this place again

This review is from over the holidays. I was there to meet a group but had arrived early so I went to the bar to wait and have a drink. It took forever to get either bartenders' attention. They were busy but after watching them go back and forth; not stopping to greet or acknowledge me sitting there, I finally just got her attention. That was a little off putting, I know it was a busy night.  The atmosphere is definitely club meets sushi restaurant. They had a DJ that started about 830 or so. Know that it will be loud if you come here on a weekend.  Fine with our group as we had booked our dinner with the intention of a place to have a little fun. We were seated in one of the back rooms which was nice to put a little distance from the music so we chat and catch up. Dinner was fantastic.  Obviously there is a full sushi menu and other dishes. The Korean beef ribs were really good. I also had the black cod and it was well flavored and a good size portion. Everyone seemed to enjoy their dinner selections. Our server was great and kept up with the constant flow of drinks and champagne bottles being ordered. The owner made it a point to come to our table. She even sat with us for a bit and chatted. She walks around a lot talking to almost every table and chatting with regulars. She really seems like she wants to make sure everyone that comes to her restaurant has a good time, good food and good drinks.  We made our way back to the bar for after dinner drinks. I had a lychee martini-it was really good and strong. I am giving 4 stars because I think you never get a 2nd chance to make a 1st impression, and my initial experience at the bar wasn't the best. Overall a great night out and I definitely recommend it especially if you want to enjoy great food in a club like atmosphere. And I have always heard good things about Nikko's.

You do not want to go to this place if you are expecting good service.  They care more about making it a club setting while trying to serve dinner. We had 5 people and one ordered sushi everyone finished their dinner before the sushi even came to the table.  It took over 5 minutes to get drinks to come to the table.  I do not think I will come back.  This place is way overrated and priced for what you get.  There are a lot better place to go and with better service.

I absolutely love the Sushi here. The rolls are great and the service is always excellent. The sexy salmon is to die for! Each time I come I try a new roll and I am always impressed. It's definitely a place I would go over and over again.

By my check-ins you guys should now know my love for sushi.... That being said, eh.  I went to Nikko because it is walking distance and I am currently unable to drive. Lets just say I'll stick to ordering delivery or getting an uber to drive me to my favorites for now.  The sushi was nothing to write home about. My main takeaway was that the sushi was small and was mostly rice. We ordered the Rainbow, spicy tuna, godzilla, and then the cowboy roll. The gozilla and cowboy roll were recommend by our waitress after asking us what flavors we like (spicy is my jam ;)  ). The gozilla roll was on point, good recommendation. I was excited for the Cowboy roll, I thought it would be like the surf and turf roll at cowfish, unfortunately it was not. My friend took one bite and decided it was awful. I just didn't think the flavors mixed well together. Of course my friend was talked into one more piece, where we both decided that it is much better cold and to not dip it in soy sauce. I finished the rest of it like a champ because momma didn't  raise a quitter. (That is a total lie, mom would definitely say I should stop eating when I'm full)  Our bill was slightly over $100 without tip at that point,  we did have a couple drinks with dinner as well. Ijust wasn't impressed.  Really the stars are for the staff and the ambience. Are waitress was lovely, I have zero complaints besides the recommendation of the cowboy roll. Also the place is pretty neat looking with cozy booths, and large circular tables for big parties.   Good luck fellow Yelpers!

The only reason why it's getting 2 stars is because the good is actually good here. But the service has been absolutely awful this evening. Drinks have been forgotten. The waiter forgot to put in our birthday girl's order. When he told her that he forgot, they STILL didn't put it in. When they realized they messed up, they stopped coming to check on us. The drinks were not up to standard. Needless to say, this used to be a place we come, but won't be back anymore. Surely disappointed in the evening.

I could eat sushi for ever meal and this was one of the worst quality sushi places that I've been to in Charlotte. Their sushi wasn't what I expected. Me along with 5 other girls were extremely disappointed in all of our rolls. After biting into one of my rolls I pulled 2 chunks of plastic out. After bringing attention to my waitress she told her manager and he didn't even come over and apologize. I wasn't able to eat any more of my meal after that. Our waitress had a terrible attitude all night and was pretty rude. Safe to say we all agreed that we will never be eating here again.

Great sushi! Even better staff. It's a great place to go for "happy hour" when you want to let your hair down and feel sexy!!! The owner is a little fire cracker be prepared to dance with her on the weekends.
Try their Super Crunchy Roll! I swear this is the best Sushi place in Charlotte.

Nikko is fun for a club like ambience if you're party mood.  I've been to Nikko several times due to friend's celebrations, etc.  The food is pretty mediocre and bland for certain dishes.  My biggest complaint during my last randevú would have to be the THICK sashimi slices.  Mind you, I have a LOVE for sashimi but it has to be cut in edible portions for you to devour and enjoy, piece by piece.  The thick slices made the meal less appetizing and I had to cut all of the sashimi down to pieces.  The sashimi gave me an upset stomach, it's either that or the multiple incorrect drink orders that were place in front of me (Parton instead of Tito's).  The pros for this place include the friendly owner and the manager Anthony.  All in all, I know I have to revisit this establishment again in the future and want to provide this constructive feedback so Nikko can fix the cuts of the sashimi.

Nikko is a great sushi place!  I came here only two days after I had moved to Charlotte, and was surprised to see how busy and bumpin it was on a Thursday night around 7.  Don't let the look of it from the outside fool you, I was worried we'd have to wait awhile, but the restaurant is huge and a lot of people sit up at the bar, so there was no wait for us at all! Very good selection of sushi, and our waiter was very helpful (even though she said it was only her first week).  The rolls were tight and very tasty.  Vegetable tempura was a good start.   Prices not bad, it's sushi after all, cheap sushi scares me anyway :-)

Start by saying the sushi is decent not the worst I've had but not the best either also a little pricey.   Summary: order the sushi and nothing else, don't go on the weekends or you will be at club Nikko's where there is no dance floor but the DJ is pumping out techno so loud you can't hear anyone at your own table, and be ready to pay a pretty penny for mediocre sushi.  Now as for the 2 stars. Went to Nikko's last night for a business dinner and I'm on a no carb diet so I order a NY strip steak with a side salad. Granted I know this is not a steak house and they probably cook one steak a week, but I expected a little better for the 27$ price tag. First off, I asked for ranch as my salad dressing and was told they only have a house dressing. Which is weird since they have literally 8 different full size salads on the menu. I ordered my steak medium rare and when I receive the steak it's barely a quarter inch thick, no was on earth was is an 8oz steak. To top it off it was well done and covered in teriyaki sauce. I sent it back and got back a black and blue steak (raw in the middle) which I much rather eat than a well done steak, but still not what I asked for. That being said service is always on point and quick with the refills and are normally decently friendly.   Side note what is up with the pictures of what I can only assume to be the owner everywhere in different costumes? Also be prepared to see her in rare form on the weekends in a costume or cowboy hat walking around taking pictures with people....

Nice modern hip looking place. Attractive customers and I felt I was in for a treat.  I sat at the sushi bar as I had to get my fish fix. I travel a lot and good sushi is usually something I look for. Hard to find however...  I ordered the sushi/sashimi omakase which leaves it up to the chef to choose what you get. My only stipulation...no mackerel! Now what I got was fresh and delicious with good portions, but sadly, for the premium price of this meal, I got the same old selection; tuna, salmon, shrimp, eel and a whitefish. I was hoping for some octopus, yellowtail or even pay extra for some butterfish (which I've only had once at Ki in Toronto and it's like buttah baby!). The roll was some lame spicy salmon or something like that with fake crab filler. I never usually order rolls but if I do I love the rainbow roll. I'm all about the fish.  Sake was Ty Ku black which is always good and dry. If you want to drop some sake cash, try the Ty Ku white. Sake and sushi, love love love.  For what I got it deserves a solid 4 stars but because of the lack of imagination and even weak presentation, I give it 3 starfish.

This rating is solely based on their sushi -- their delicious, unique, flavor packed sushi. Located in South End, this restaurant and sushi bar has a bomb Specialty Creation sushi menu that hits on all types of flavor combinations! They've also got full service bar so if you don't like any of their cocktails or want any wine from their large wine menu, you can pretty much ask them to make anything your heart desires.  Service is good. It doesn't get overly busy so request to sit in a booth if you can or sit at the sushi bar and watch them make the rolls! They've even got a private room for if you have a party/celebration.   Recommendations:  * Volcano Roll: shrimp tempura roll topped with a spicy baked mix of scallops, crab, and octopus. If you love warm rolls and/or spicy rolls get this one! * Dancing Queen: steamed asparagus and spicy tuna, topped with spicy guacamole and tempura chips. This roll is cold but super refreshing with the guacamole on it! If you're looking to be adventurous, I would seriously try this one.

My friend and I were just looking for somewhere to have a nice dinner so we thought we'd check out the new Nikko location (just down the street from the old spot). Boy, that was a mistake. We weren't dressed in stilettos and short dresses, so we definitely didn't fit in. The wait for a table was unpleasant and long. With the color-changing panels, the restaurant's hip decor is just trying way too hard. It looks like something someone would build in the Sims. I mean, Charlotte is growing and slowly becoming more cosmopolitan, but Nikko is just over the top. The food was all right, though not incredibly impressive. We were already kind of angry at the whole experience by the time we finally got to eat.

Thank you, Nikko, for the best sushi we've had in a while!   We felt special from the superb valet parking service to...well...the superb valet parking service when we left!  We sat at the sushi bar and enjoyed a lovely sampler platter last Saturday, including sashimi, nigiri sushi and a tasty slightly spicy tuna roll.  For a couple of hungry people, the Sushi/Sashimi Omakase is a great value at about $36.  We also shared Age Dashi Tofu with Shrimp, served piping hot with an amazingly rich (almost beefy) dashi broth.  House sake is good.  This place has incredible atmosphere, and is a great 'night out on the town' place to go.  Decor is gorgeous and modern.  We were dressed pretty casual, but didn't feel under-dressed.  The sushi bar is fun and lively - and the prep line is impeccably clean and orderly.  Fish is fresh-fresh-fresh.  The chefs are well-trained and conscientious.  Bravo to the ownership and management.  Friday and Saturday nights, if you are in the restaurant around 7:30 or 8, you will feel a transformation as the lighting changes and the DJ starts mixing.  It gets LOUD.  But it's fun.  Nikko has great energy!  This is one of Charlotte's best.

My first ever yelp post I've ever done - We made a reservation to go on a Saturday night and although the food was great, our waitress forgot my wine order and eventually brought it to the table a few minutes after everyone else's drinks (we all ordered drinks at the same time) - which is fine, definitely wouldn't knock stars off for that.  Then, we ordered our food (again, all at the same time) and the waitress again brought out everyone's order at the table at the same time, but yet again my order didn't come until everyone else was finished eating.  The waitress said that it was a different chef making my order? and didn't apologize for the sushi being so late.  Then, a person in our party ordered another glass of the wine she was having and the waitress brought a glass of the wine I was drinking, not her.  When the bill came, I was still expected to pay full price for my meal and the second glass of wine that I didn't order.....  Food was great, but the waitress we had was less than alright.

The owner is a total b!tch.. She ordered appetizers for our large group of 17 people (at no ones request mind you) and tacked on another $400 to our bill. We were blown away.. The servers were great but we've never had a more unprofessional experience at a restaurant!!

I recommend Nikko's. The sushi is good and the atmosphere is awesome. The waitstaff is good, but the bartenders could speed it up. Sometimes the restaurant gets pretty busy so we will order drinks while we wait on a table, but it can take a little while sometimes. Very cool place to go with friends. Make a reservation if it's going to be a group and you want a good table.

Can't believe the #manager and #service at #nikkos tonight. We were basically told "your party can leave now" after we sent our food back because our food was cold. He asked, "why did you eat out of it first?" Ummm, how would we know it was cold if we hadn't? ?After many visits to this establishment, I am truly shocked and disappointed......but hey, ?

I've been to Nikko several times for birthdays and other special occasions. It seems fun, has awesome loud music and a DJ, and the sushi is more than decent. Their downfall is the service. The restaurant starts to get a club vibe after 8 pm on a Saturday and that's all fine and good -- some restaurants are very successful with a club/restaurant scene. But Nikko simply isn't good at it. The servers are far too flustered and backed up and distracted. Three out of 17 of our guests NEVER received their food. None of it. Not even an update. Those three guests left the restaurant to eat at a fast food chain down the street, instead. And again, this was for someone's birthday! The owner should focus more on great customer service, and spend less time dancing with drunk patrons. It was a horrible experience and put a really bad taste in my mouth. I won't be back for a celebration of any sort.

I'm not usually a sushi fan but I thought this place was really good.  I got the panko crusted scallops appetizer and cowboy roll and they were both great.  It was overall a little pricey but worth it.

1) Service, superb ;-) every staff member I encountered was friendly. It was a somewhat bland Sunday afternoon so not a lot of patrons, but  service was very efficient.  2) Food, excellent! I had the chicken teriyaki Nice portion sizes and prepared  just right. Also there is literally A BOOK for the wine selection alone! I'd come here just for that!  3) Ambiance, purely awesome.  4) Decor, simply gorgeous - interior is very modernistic Japanese style.  5) Great location!  There's the 5 stars. Yes, the menu is pricy. However, the combination of these 5 factors is what must be considered. Therefore worth it.
very good.  Great service.  The food is a bit pricey, but the restaurant ambiance is fantastic.  I would recommend for special occasions or group night's out.
I met this sushi chef, Soe, today and he is pretty innovative with his sushi - creating delicious and original dishes/rolls - as all sushi chefs should.  Picture attached.

Be prepared for 30 plus minute wait on weekend evening, we told there was a 30 minute wait then not seated for over an hour. We had to inquire as to why we'd not been seated and were told because we'd not closed our bar tab, Ok might have been nice to know considering we told the host we'd be at the bar. They have a full service bar with a very attentive bar staff. Service in general once seated was slow, the variety and quality of food sort of makes up for that issue. If you are a sushi person I feel certain you will enjoy their sushi bar/menu.  My husband had several raw sushi dishes that he enjoyed as well as a veggie roll dish we shared that was very good. My only disappointment was my rice cake, it was very tough, not a lot of taste and dry. My husband "upgraded" his rice with meal for fried rice for only $1 but it wasn't even worth the $1!!! It was very much like my fried rice cake, dry, mushy and little to no taste. That said we enjoyed the meal enough that we'd go back again. I'm not sure if our true age is beginning to "show" as we found their in house DJ to be playing much to loud. Music with a meal is always nice but when you feel as if you have to shout to hear the person directly next and or across from you, it's not enhancing to the meal. Again all of this said we'd for sure go back, just maybe not on a weekend evening.

Fantastic sushi spot with great energy!  Super sexy cool interior (can we say HUGE upgrade from their old space?!?!)  I love coming here for a fantastic sushi experience.  It WILL bite your wallet tho - a recent outing for 2 cost over 100 bucks - but was worth it!    They have valet parking most nights, but there is a free parking garage too if you drive past the valet dudes.  The spots are marked - they want you to park on only certain levels for the restaurant (I think it is level 4?)  Anyways - every time I have been the sushi has been super fresh and delicious.  They are very generous with roe topped-rolls and will bring you extra ginger upon request.    I was also delighted here one time by the seafood udon.  It wasn't the best I have ever had in my life but it was very good and very expensive.  Probably two can share this soup because it is so large.   It is a fun night when you go and the proprietor is there dancin around.  She loves it when you have a good time!    Their high-tops are great for people-watching and the djs they have keep the place hoppin.  Love it!  Thanks Nikko!

I've gone here a few times and it's nothing out of this world.   The staff here is friendly and the food is ordinary. The space the restaurant is located in is nice and modern. I feel that they have settled into their routine and are coasting. That's not a bad thing, it just doesn't spring up top of mind when you say 'Let's go get sushi!' The food was good; the pricing was ok. My experiences have been uneventful at this location. I'd give it 2.5 stars if I could.

First impressions: cool place, great atmosphere with lots of energy (didn't mind the loud music)... great potential right?  Wrong... the sushi was just average and the wine list was horribly inappropriate for a sushi restaurant.  I left feeling like this is nothing but a "scene" - everybody puts on their party clothes and we all pretend the food/wine is great because this is not your typical boring restaurant, so we give them a free pass.  But in a town as big as CLT, we should expect more.  Its not good enough to just put a DJ up front and spin dance tunes... you gotta follow it up with quality food and wine.  Is that too much to ask?  Expect more Charlotte!

Delicious! Even though we went on New Years Eve the service was great! The wait was kinda lengthy but that's to be expected. Our waitress was friendly and made delicious recommendations. I had the green curry chicken and shrimp and my fiance had a rib plate that was full of flavor. I'll add pictures. We will be back!

Best sushi I've ever had. Sushi Boat Fan #1! (Wish I had more stomach to eat everything from the menu, though.) Valet service. Friendly service. Ambient, chic, night-life kind of feel with an open floor plan. Well-kept clean restrooms and dining area. We live quite a bit away from Charlotte but we'll travel there for the sushi for when we need awesome sushi. So yeah, 5 stars!

New Year's Eve - We appreciated the valet on this cold night. The sushi was great and we both agreed, freshest we've ever had. We ordered the sushi for two boat and although New Year's Eve was slammed, packed, and almost to standing room only, we had our meal in only about an hour. [The soup and salad were both delicious. A+ on hippy, casual, chic atmosphere.]

Like transporting yourself to NYC with it's trendy beats in the background and the contemporary flair.  I love it!  The food is really great, I actually had my first Udon Noodle plate here and although the food was something new to me, it was really good.  The girlfriend and I ordered a Hawaiian roll of some sort prior for an appetizer and it was excellent as well.  You can tell why this place is popular.  It is apparently where all the beautiful people hang out as I've been told.  I would say that this is my new high end sushi choice just edging out Enso by a nose.

Been here twice now, once on a first date and last visit for a birthday dinner. The atmosphere is very nice and festive (esp with the Christmas decor) and the service is top notch.  The first visit was fun, bc the owner came around and did sake bombs with us, singing and tossing her cowboy hat.  This past visit was pretty low-key, but still our server was gracious and attentive.  I had sushi the first time and although very pricey, it was good.  This past visit I ordered the chicken teriyaki dinner...... Not impressive.  I asked for extra broccoli and mushrooms for the stir fried veggies. She said those weren't veggies that were used (cabbage, zucchini and squash were) and I told her that was fine and that I would pay additional for them. (Word to the wise, this cost me $5.00 for some twigs of broccoli and a few shiitake mushrooms) I ordered fried rice ($1extra) and when my meal came it was presented well, but the chicken looked as though it had been sautéed plain in chunks and soy/ponzu/teriyaki sauce was poured over it along with some sesame seeds. Way too salty and not very good. The fried rice and veggies were good.  For what we ordered as a couple (my meal, with all the additions) and three basic sushi rolls, two pieces of nigiri, and a beer it was $72.  Way too much for what we got. When I can eat sushi again, I will head to my fave Rusans. :)

The food was ok.  The atmosphere was very lively for a younger crowd.  The only real complaint was the snarky little bald guy working the hostess/host stand.  Fortunately the bar and wait staff were better.

Great sushi restaurant on the south end. They have a parking lot if you keep driving to the back but they also Parteners with a valet company. Upon entering I was greeted and seated. I had a reservation. It was crowded and their was some music bumping. They have a DJ! The vibe is fun funky cool setting. The waitress was nice, knowledgeable, and didn't miss a beat. I appreciate that! The food was good I had two sushi rolls, the dragon and the shrimp tempura, and my friend had a meal, steak and shrimp. The lychee martini was nice. I would come back just for this drink and a quick roll at the table top area. The martini was simple and strong. Overall nice spot and good vibe. I'll be back and I think you should try.

Great sushi.  Mid-range price, a little on the expensive side but worth it for the atmosphere and unique sushi choices.    Good for lunch too, quick call-ahead-take-out.  Highly recommended to those who enjoy good Japanese food in a quiet atmosphere.  Even at 12 during the week the place is very accomodating and very good.  The only reason I don't give 5 stars is because Sushi 101 is better!!!

Wow! Its a dining experience for all senses...sounds goofy,I know...but its good food, with broad spectrum of asian food & sushi represented here...rolls I had were great...I am not super adventerous w/sushi, so go w/that...great drinks, attentive staff...but its def. hoppin in there...make reservations for the weekend, great place to celebrate birthdays...GREAT PEOPLE WATCHING....I could have just sat in the corner & watched all evening ;) Not overly pricey...great locale for Charlotte...this place has been here for years & will be for years to come. Word to the wise, Its super, super loud in there & when staff is busy, they are super busy...so know what you want, & quickly.

Don't ever order a takeout(to-go) from here. They will start making your food when you actually get there to pick up even though you ordered hours in advance.  There are tons of better sushi place in Charlotte. So find somewhere else.

Their decor and atmosphere is amazing. Their kalbi is amazing as well, cooked perfectly. Everything else, was just a bust. Their shrimp tempura roll left a lot to the imagination to be desired. Their calamari, just tasted so much better before hand. I think more people go for the environment rather than the quality of the food. However, there are better restaurants than this, I would definitely choose CUISINE MALAYA sushi anyday. They seem to have a lot more variety but  more importantly, their food just tastes better.

Sushi was wonderful, plenty to choose from. Entrees were creative and fairly well done, however overpriced.  Atmosphere was trendy but the music was so loud that conversation was impossible. As the music would fade or lower you could hear everyone yelling at each other (it was kind of funny actually.) Our server was very nice but slow.

I'm a sushi snob.  I am.  Sushi at a supermarket?  No way.  I've eaten at many high end sushi restaurants, so I fancy myself smarter than the average bear when it comes to sushi.   I dig Nikko.  1) it's hip.  You walk in and it's like you're in NYC.  2) The food is just damn good.    I've been here 3 times now since moving to Charlotte almost 2 months ago.  All three times - just great.    I never get sake, so I can't comment on that.  I got a martini the first time and have gotten Kirin draft every other time.  Yummy.   The fish - I've never had a poor piece of fish there.  It's all very fresh and is well prepared.  Warning - they put a lot of wasabi on their nagiri.  You've been warned.    They have some really inventive rolls.  The crispy salmon roll is really good.  The crazy roll (served in some sort of cocktail glass) is not good.  Avoid at all costs.   All the staff have been very nice, although busy at certain points, so it's a pain if you need another beer.  However - One waiter gave me a great tip about their tuna tartare - they put a raw quail egg on top.  Ask for it without that.   Enjoy - this place is a keeper.  I'll be there pretty often.  *** Update as of 3/8/2008 *** I had their tuna tartare a few days ago.  I would avoid this dish.  It's basically their spicy tuna mixture sans the spicy.  More weird to eat it without a roll...

I came here for a friends bday dinner and was quite impressed with the mix of a DJ in a Japanese restaurant. I was also impressed with the fact that we had 8pm reservations but the guest of honor didn't arrive until 8:45 and they still held her table ! Other than that, that was the highlight. It was a table of 10 and 2 servers yet they failed to ever be on the same page. One waiter took on side of the tables order, while the other waitress seemed to be no where in sight. Service was extremely slow and the waiters were hard to come around when you needed something as simple as a fork. We had multiple misunderstandings throughout the night which maybe I can attribute to the DJ. Overall the food was pretty good and I would definitely give it another shot with a smaller party.

Way way Way way way too loud to have a conversation with anybody.... Best part about a meal is the people you have with you. This dance floor music is ridiculous... sashimi and the food was very good. Just the ambience was terrible...shoot!

I am not impressed.  I am from California and love me some sushi.  This place is nothing but smokme and mirrors.  Hence the Great venue, this place has a great venue and decor its a Architech's dream but a food critics nightmare.  The Sushi was WAAAYY OVERPRICED.  I mean come on a tekka roll one of them ost cheapest thing on any sushi menu at any sushi place was 11 dollars.  Something that would cost me $4.95 in my best sushi place in California.  Its soooo  ridiculous.  The 30 waiters that were hanging around the restraunt and the 4 hostesses I dont see how anyone in Charlotte considers this place one of the best sushi places in Charlotte!  I did however find a halfway decent place that kinda worth anything sushi wise in the city of Charlotte and thats Yama Sushi in Southpark area.
Had a great experience here . The cocktails are fantastic . Sushi was good . Service was good .

Nikko is a Charlotte establishment when it comes to sushi.  With modern design and a sexy layout in lighting even the bathrooms are nice.  You pay for all this "high profile" look and feel for this place by the pricing of the sushi, which is very good, but I feel like I'm paying NYC prices in NC????  With DJs playing certain times of the week and Joanna chanting more sake bombs and dancing around with a boa this place is a little of everything.  The wait staff here is always good, but not very engaging.  Parking involves valet or parking in the deck, but the deck is a real pain....I don't like that aspect of this experience.  What is good is I can catch the light rail down there from the center city which is a real plus.  People watching is very good here and the place can get loud.  So for an overall good time while getting your sushi on, this is the place for you............and me.

I order the rainbow roll where ever I go. It's basically a california roll with fish (Salmon, Yellowtail, tuna) drapped over it.  I was so disappointed by what I recieved at nikkos.  Only half the rolls had fish drapped over it and the other half had avacado. This is not a cheap place and I felt shorted that they cheaped out on half my fish.   I have gone to this place for a long time. It's a beautiful restraurant. The service is always great. The food quality is always good. I am so dissappointed that they have started to cut corners.

I think it goes without saying that this place is awesome!  From the trendy atmosphere and art deco on the wall to the cowboy hat wearin', pocket sized owner/manager, this place is wicked fun!  The food is excellent.  Four of us went on friday, GET THERE BEFORE 7:30 on a busy night and you walk in like VIP! After, you'd probably get a vibrating beeper deal and a bar stool!  The waiter was attentive and friendly. The prizes were not cheap, however so be prepared to spend a pretty penny on some raw fish!   We ordered quite a variety, not just the rolls and everything was savory and delicious!  I definitely recommend it to all looking for a sushi extravaganza!

A friend chose this place for sushi....I met her there with my one year old. I ordered spider roll it was delicious.......but when it got to my table there were 5 pieces....menu says 6-8 pieces. Told server 1 was missing....he said it was cut thick. Well, why would they bring out a smaller amount. Sooo server said he can take it back to cut one to make 6.....just make mine right the FIRST TIME!!  There was nothing on the menu that I could order for my daughter so I asked if I could order a small order of plain noodles. Lol my server said he asked the MANAGER and he said he will only give me a full order of noodles which was waaay too much for a baby to eat and had to charge me the full price. Have you ever heard of accommodating customers? My husband and I have heard about this restaurant and nice atmosphere....when we have our date night we were looking forward to trying it.....after learning that if your situation is different like having a young child and they can't even provide options....we will definitely not be dining there. I had to go to my car and look for crackers and treats for her to eat. Really uncalled for. Server was nice....if u really wanna try it out ask for Justin.....although the manager seems like a jerk...Justin made what I had a little better.

Sat for 15 minutes and no one even offered us water. Three waitresses walked by and didn't say a word. HORRIBLE PLACE. Treat patrons like they're an inconvenience. Spend your hard earned dollars somewhere else! I'll never go again.

BEST sushi in town!!! Very nice restaurant. The staff are all friendly!! Parking deck attached to the place which makes parking no problem at all. I have been to this place during lunch and for dinner. Lunch is a more relaxing atmosphere. At night, especially on the weekends, there is usually a DJ playing music throughout the place. You may want to make reservations for dinner and on the weekends. They also have a patio area to sit outside if the weather permits. Dress code=casual/dressy  Best sushi rolls to try 1. SPICY SHRIMP & CRAB SALAD ROLL and 2. SUPER CRUNCHY ROLL. Also ask for sushi specials!  As far as the other food, it was okay. I've ordered the filet mignon, with fried rice, miso soup, and salad with ginger dressing. The salad and dressing is by far better than Nakatos. The other food I ordered was smaller in portions compared with Nakatos. If you are looking for larger portions and for the cook to prepare food before you, I would try Nakatos. If you would like to order from the menu and GOOD sushi, this is the place for you!!!!

This place makes me uncomfortable. It feels more like somewhere for martinis and dancing than traditional Japanese food and sushi. The environment is quite clean and fancy but is more along the modern-aggressive feel than restaurant-y and welcoming.  Prices are a bit high for what you're getting (example: a Vegetable Roll cut into 6 pieces is $6. C'mon, to make that is almost 100% profit). The staff were friendly and good about water refills, the valet staff were really nice.  Eh, I don't think I'll be back but it was an experience for sure.

Nikko is definitely the fanciest sushi place in Charlote--and again, it's  not even close. This place is super scene-y--lots of banker types there all done up, lots of make-up'd women in fancy clothes. Seriously, when you go to Nikko you feel like you're in some swanky sushi place in LA or Miami, which is fine if that's what you're in the mood for.   As a result, Nikko is pretty expensive, although you're getting pretty good bang for your buck--most of the sushi is actually really good. Definitely a place to come to be seen, though, which means the bar is super active and crowded, especially on thursdays and the weekend. It really gets a clubby/lounge-like atmosphere on these nights, so don't expect a nice, quiet meal. Far from it. Good sushi bar aspect though--you can sit there easily. Reservations can be tough sometimes, or at least it's not that easy to just show up and sit right away. Definitely popular.  The food takes a backseat to the meal itself, which is what some people there are hoping for. Indeed, good place to have a birthday dinner with friends. Maybe decent date spot. Note the owner, who goes running around making a scene.

My third time visiting Nikki's and I'm definitely a fan of this establishment. Very hip and trendy! Perfect spot for a date night or dinner and drinks with friends. There's also a private area for birthdays and special events. During my first visit, I noticed a DJ in the corner, not sure if this is a weekend thing or not.   Personally I love the sushi! Endless options of unique flavors and combinations. My cousin and I dined here a few weeks ago. She's NEVER tried Sushi before! So this was a first! Everything was perfection!! The service is great, I've never had a bad experience. Parking sucks, so your better off with valet parking.   There's lots of options for non-sushi lovers. I plan to try the Ramen during my next visit. The Cocktails!!! Amazing!! Half off on Thursdays! Be sure to try the Pear Sakitni!! So delish!!

I like this place. Good atmosphere and good sushi. The reason for 1 star is that it is advertised as gluten free friendly. My sister has celiacs, so to double check we called to make sure. They said yes! We are! When we got there (after ordering a bottle of wine) we were informed that there was not options for her. When we talked to the manager, he got a really big attitude. Bad experience. It's just frustrating that they market as friendly, but have no options. Educate yourselves.

Great date place, especially if you get one of the big, cushy, round booths. The decor is pretty awesome, too. Very contemporary - you can tell a lot of money went into this place.   Best bets would be: crunchy tuna roll (you actually get yummy tuna steak slices, as opposed to mashed tuna salad); and the yellowtail jalapeno sashimi (freshest fish I've tasted, honestly).   For dessert: the chocolate spice cake is TO DIE FOR.  If you get the chance to head to the lady's room -- be not afraid, the frosted windowed stalls turn opaque as soon as you step in!  ALSO: beware (or delight): we were there on Friday night and as we left, there was a DJ setting up. So I guess it turns into one big party Friday night, if that's what you're into!
A must stop in Charlotte. Amazing energy, wonderful staff, good food. It's a family affair.

Definitely the best sushi experience in Charlotte.  The tuna crunchy roll with the doctor david sauce is a combination of tastes that is unmatched.  Joanna and James continue to deliver great service.

The supposed best ginger dressing in town was very watery. Spicy tuna roll was mostly rice, hardly any tuna. Had the dragonfly and Nikko roll, neither were good. If you name a roll after your restaurant, it better be damn good.
Our server was on a different planet.  The food was just ok.  The sushi bar in the epicenter is way better.

Haven't eaten Japanese in quite some time. I really liked it here. As a vegetarian, I had lots of choices. I had Teriyaki Tofu, Miso Soup, Mango/Cabbage salad, tempura and vegetarian roll. This was a little too much food for 1 person. I would eliminate tofu to make it just right. It got a little noisy, but that's the Nikko scene. I'm glad I took taxi and got there around 7:30 pm. When me and my friend left, it was mobbed by 8:30 pm. All in all - great food, great atmosphere, classy bathrooms.

Nikko and I go way back to the time when the restaurant was located in the much smaller space in the building just north of the current location, which is in the pink high-rise on South Boulevard. At that time owner/sushi chef Joanna was there most of the time and I dined often at the sushi bar for the spicy tuna roll, the "Trust Me" roll as well as the "Super Crunchy Roll". Since then, Nikko has expanded into its current huge space with a full bar and lounge area. The menu has also expanded to include many traditional Japanese dishes as well as sushi.  I recently had a quick lunch here on my own and enjoyed it. The sushi rolls were good as usual and the salad with ginger dressing is always pleasing. I look forward to returning soon, but I do miss the intimacy of the original location. Still, I'm glad to see Joanna doing so well and it's great to have good sushi in the neighborhood.

We ordered the sushi deluxe and did not like it at all. Too over priced for the quality and portion size... We put all of our marbles on the dessert but that was also a big disappointment. It was the first time I saw my boyfriend not finish chocolate cake.  The only reason why it has two stars is because the music by DJ bicnasti was good and the restaurant is nicely decorated.

My review is mostly for the amazing and genuine service and atmosphere! The servers were very nice, answered all questions asked and brought the drinks and salad out quick. This restaurant is special because, my best friend got engaged here tonight! All of the staff members were excited, brought over champagne, took pics when we asked and had no issue with us screaming loud from excitement. For this I would suggest the restaurant. I am allergic to shell fish so, I order the salmon and mixed vegetable salad. It was 'ok' nothing too special! This is a sushi restaurant so word of advice get the sushi and enjoy

Nikko, why have I waited until now to try you? I did not realize what I was missing. Walked in Friday at about 7 and they were able to get us right in without a reservation.   The atmosphere was really cool- very busy but it didn't feel overly crowded.The kitchen was open which I always like.   Our service was great and the pacing of the meal was perfect.   We started with an appetizer, the Tuna Tataki which was prepared beautifully. I would have liked a little more ponzu sauce but the flavors were spot on.  Next we had three rolls: The Volcano, Nikko, and Spider . All were fantastic- I would get any again.   A bit pricey but the quality and taste of each roll was outstanding.   I will be back soon!

We do team events here pretty often too. Unfortunately, Nikko is not able to acccomodate us when the group gets too large.   That aside, ths place has good sushi and at times when I would crave a good sushi meal, I would even hop into the limo to pick-up dinner.
Good food, tons of fun on the weekend with the live dj and larger-than-life owner. Had a problem with our bill and she was extremely accommodating. Will absolutely be back for the experience alone.

Finally! A visit that ended well. I've been trying to have a pleasant experience at Nikko for approximately 4 yrs.  I remember when the restaurant was small and quaint, located in Uptown. Service was so much better then. Once it grew, service began to fall. I've made reservations that were not honored. Saturdays... the music is entirely too loud to enjoy each other at the table. Waiting time has been horrific. It seems, on the weekends, operationally.. there needs to be some tweeking to make sure the patrons have an excellent experience. I've said all of this to say...go on a WEEKDAY! You will have your server's undivided attention. Food will arrive in an expedited fashion. There are parking spaces available. The music is at the right volume. You're not waiting 20 mins for valet. I really enjoyed myself this trip.

Made a reservation for 9:30pm and had to wait well over 45 minutes to be seated. No coffee. .no variations of tea... drinks were watered down... Deluxe Sushi plate was very blah!  No imagination whatsoever!  I'm VERY disappointed in this place especially since I am a patron who ventured in when the restaurant first established itself in the uptown area. The only highlights were the owner dancing and our server who was VERY attentive!  By the way,  this is the second time I've had to wait past the time my reservation was set for. The first time I was told although I had a reservation,  it was a 2 hr wait.  My party and I went to Fusion in Dilworth instead who were mindful of their patrons.

We came here with another couple for dinner. I've heard about this place and have always wanted to try it out. We did valet for parking. We got sat right away. Our server was friendly and helpful. The shrimp shumai was good and cooked well. I got a roll of sushi and it was fresh. My only 2 complaints is that I asked if they had chili oil and they said they did and when I received it I got sesame oil and I went to the bathroom and I saw a worker there who used the bathroom and she didn't really wash her hands. She turned the water on and put her hands underneath and didn't even use soap! Gross.

I love sushi.  I think this is a great modern restaurant in a hip and up and coming area of the city.  For starters I stopped by the bar to wait for the rest of my party.  I had the cucumber crisp martini and it was so good.  The bartender cautioned that it was mostly vodka with some muddled cucumbers and a little simple syrup, so that makes it not too sweet.  It was so refreshing and a great start.  The bartender was also fabulous and had I not been meeting a big party, I would have dined with him at the bar top.    When our party all arrived we were seated and ordered a variety of apps.  The calamari and beef tataki were my favorites.  The calamari is flash fried with sauce drizzled on the top.  It has a touch of spice to it and heat on the back end, which I loved.  The beef tataki was seared perfect, but it did have some cajun type spices on the outside which I wasn't crazy over.  But the sliced cucumbers on the plate with it were amazing.  They were drenched in ponzu sauce and if I had been at home I would have licked that plate!  For the main course I chose the Christmas roll (topped with shrimp and avacado) and also a few pieces of nigiri.  Overall the food and service was great.  Everything is decently priced and in keeping with other sushi restaurants in the city.  The atmosphere is great and we went on a Sunday, which wasn't too crowded.  But during weekend nights I can see it getting quite crowded.  Overall a great place for food and drinks!

Being from Los Angeles I'm pretty spoiled by the great selection of sushi. In my search to find a decent sushi restaurant in Charlotte, I came across Nikko's.  The environment is very plush and swanky. The service has always been courteous and attentive on my visits.  The sushi is a 3/5 for me .... It's the best that I have been able to find in Charlotte, although I don't know if that's saying much. The prices were a bit higher than I would have liked to pay but  the atmosphere balances it out.

I've been a fan of Nikko for years but after the last two or three visits, I have to update my review, one star down.  The Good: Service is still solid albeit quiet and the sushi menu is creative and tasty. There's a item for everyone and if you seek some interesting rolls, you can likely find them on the menu. Plus, the place is conducive to large groups ready for sake-bombing. Don't forget the complimentary valet!  The Bad: The prices were already a bit high for the market but over the past few months, Nikko raised the price of many of its rolls and specials. While the increase was only a dollar or two each, that certainly adds up on the final bill.   While the price increase is a bit irritating, it's even more so due to the fact that the rolls are significantly smaller and not as fresh. Sad panda. I was also pretty disenchanted by the soy sauce splattered menus and funky scent coming from one particular booth. No, it wasn't us. We showered.  Nikko is still a fair place to check out, but for me the quality has gone down as of late.
Great sushi and Japanese food! I love the lively/energetic atmosphere and they have a DJ on the weekends. It's a great place to have a birthday dinner!

Let's cut to the chase.  Parking deck close by and valet option- Yay.  Nigiri is meant to be eaten with your hands. Of course I washed mine before the food came, but no towels at the table? Unheard of.  It's a bit pricey. It is a little loud (we were there on a weeknight- I was told weekends are very very loud). Service was 2 stars. It was a week night, not busy, but our server was not paying attention enough that we needed to remind her she did not bring everything we ordered. Yet, 3 stars is totally warranted if only because the sashimi was so fresh and delicious. (The roll we ordered was some Americanized concoction so I won't hold it against the restaurant.) I'll come back for the sashimi any day.

I don't think I'll be coming to Nikko again.  If you are looking for fresh sushi at a good price, this is not the place to attend.  The prices have definitely been up since the last time I came through a few months.  Understandable in that they have overhead costs and a declining customer base, but the way to remedy that is not by having poorer quality fish and questionable service.    Came here late on a Friday night because a friend from California was in town and from what I recalled of this place, it was a nice hotspot at nights--lots of music and girls.  This time the music was blaring and there were a handful of co-eds.  The music bumping was a complete disconnect from the dining experience.  If the bar is packed and party people abound, it would make sense; however that was not the case.  Sushi was generally overpriced and the portions were definitely smaller.  I've been to plenty of sushi spots in my lifetime to know what is solid--this place, not so much.  Service was fine.  The guy was attentive and stuff like that...but I don't know about you, but hate it, hate it, hate it, when they try to upsell you and it's too obvious.   Upsell being a way for the server to get your bill as high as possible so they get a bigger tip.  We had plenty of beer, but he kept asking if we wanted more beer, perhaps more rolls, perhaps hot sake, I thought he was pretty much going to try to push anything so that his tip would be bigger.  When the server reeks of desperation upsell, it brings the dining experience down since his focal point is no longer customer enjoyment, rather it is how much cash-money he can put in his pocket.    I'm a sucker for pretty girls...maybe I come here again.  This time there was only one cutie at the bar...Place is pretty dead on a Friday night, hoping its better during the week? ;/  dmo out

I have eaten at Nikko's for many years and it is by far one of the best Sushi Restaurants in Charlotte NC.  It has modern decor with a pleasant atmosphere during the day and in the evening it is more energetic and fun. The owner is super sweet and always makes rounds to the tables to great guests.

I've been to Nikko a number of times in the past, and I always enjoyed what they had to offer.  The restaurant itself is super-stylish and spacious...with a great bar as well.  I also appreciated their extensive menu, with a great variety of sushi and maki rolls...not to mention a full rundown of Japanese specialties, like ramen, udon, teriyaki dishes and bento boxes.  And did I mention that they have great desserts, like the most delightful dish of fried ice cream with whipped cream?  Basically, this restaurant got it all covered.  If you come late at night, it lights up with music...and is an ideal place for a group outing.  You may even catch its owner with her cowboy hat dancing and prancing throughout the restaurant (Yep, this restaurant most definitely has character).  I've also been to the restaurant for lunch, and they offer great discounted specials!  It's much quieter during lunch hours as well.  Service has also been fairly good...no problems as of yet.  There's so much on their menu that I'm looking to try out, can't wait to revisit soon!
Loved the food at this place. Very nice ambiance the server was nice and promp...drinks were nice and strong!!!

The Nikko's uptown location is far suppior to this Ballantye local.  The atmosphere is so different, the uptown location is fronted by fun Joanna, and this one is on the plain side. However, they do have outdoor seating.  The food is delicious, as usual, but if you don't want to go to the city don't expect a fun substitute.

I am updating my review to 5stars bc the taste and flavor packed in the sushi at Nikkos is 100% delicious.  I loved my Hawaiian poke roll , the best roll I've had in a long time in Charlotte,  the tuna was perfectly marinated and plentiful. I could've licked my plate after eating this roll. Also, my spicy salmon roll was the right balance of savory and spice . The rolls here are hearty, combined with the right ingredients to give your tastebuds a heavenly sushi experience.

Went here on Friday the 28 for business lunch, the greeter didn't greet us , maybe because we were dressed casually , but our offices won't be hosting meetings or events here. They weren't busy but obviously under staff, took 15 minutes just to order anything . I ordered an Asian salad originally but it was the worse salad I've tasted it had no flavor, and loads of raw cabbage with chicken that was supposed to be marinated in sake? Tasted like processed deli lunch meat. Reordered the teriyaki chicken and it was dry and flavorless as well. Coworker ordered chicken curry katsu, salt overload. And another ordered Korean style ribs . That was good we all shared it being that own meals were unsatisfying. Too many other good sushi spots to pay the outrageous prices here. Go elsewhere. Poor service and poor food. Maybe their sushi is better. I didn't want to wait another 40minutes to get a roll.
My favorite sushi place in the city! So many choices, fresh fish, great service and awesome vibe!

I really like this place a lot. A group of us had dinner here to celebrate a friend's birthday and we had a blast. They have a DJ on Friday nights so the place is really live. The space is open and the decor is nice. They accommodated our large party along with other very large parties there that night with no problem. They came out and sang for my friend whose birthday it was and the owner came over and fed him cake lol. The staff was friendly and we had a really good time. Now on to the food... it was great! I ordered the mussels as an appetizer and then had the chicken and shrimp entree for dinner. I really loved the food and so did everyone else. This is a fun place to meet with friends for dinner or drinks.
Sushi is decent but over priced. The lady with the tambourine can get kind of annoying...

One of the best parts about Nikko is you never have to wait for a table! Huge seating area and a great ambiance. I never understand why it's not more crowded. Completely valet but it's also connected to a parking garage. I tried the Fox roll and had no complaints. Definitely not the best sushi I've had but it's still really good. A solid choice for sushi in South End.

Not really a sushi person so my gf and I came for some teriyaki chicken seeing it was the closet place in the area. This place is beautiful and big. Parking is frustrating. The chicken wasn't cooked all the way through and they did not have sweet carrots very disappointing.

After my first sushi experience in Charlotte (it didn't even deserve the one star), I was completely deflated. So a friend took me to Nikko, one of her favorite places.  For a $30 bento box, I expected quality. Service was great, and Nikko was entertainingly wild. Everything in my box tasted to par. My Charlotte sushi experience was looking on the up!  So why 2 stars?   Well, I didn't think much of it when I was eating my nigiri, but the slices of fish were warmer than preferred. I attributed the rise in temperature to the other things that were cooked in my box since the fish had great texture and I could tell that it was fresh...  I would say that I digest faster than the average person. By the time I was about to pay my bill, everything I ate that night exited my body. Not pleasant at all. The causation? Either something dirty, or I speculate, that warm fish - I guess it was sitting out longer than necessary. Regardless of the cause, something was not right about that dinner.  I give it one more star than my last experience because of the nice atmosphere and service, but at least the sushi from that experience stayed in my tummy.

Best sushi restaurant in Charlotte. Quality is great and prices are reasonable. I really respect the owner for always being present and love that she will take on any task necessary (seated us rather than making the hostess do it). The complementary valet also makes this a better choice than the uptown options.
Its really fresh, great atmosphere and good service.  And if your going to a game, great stop right off the light rail.  Prices are way better than cowfish and sushi is just as good.

I love Sushi.  And I can honestly say i think i found my new sushi place. The atmosphere was FANTASTIC, however, like one of the previous reviews stated, music was too loud for a Friday at 9 pm! It did feel a little like we were in Vegas or Miami.  The DJ was pretty good and I enjoyed the music.  This place really captured the essence of Charlotte and the direction Charlotte is headed.  We saw trendy and chic people who were from all different backgrounds.  Prices were on point, drinks were a tad pricey, service was pretty good, parking was free and sushi was phenomenal.
Amazing sushi! The Nikko Roll tastes sublime and has gorgeous presentation. Incredible service. Worthy of the upscale prices.

I quite enjoyed Nikko's very much.  They had pretty swag furniture in there.  I should've made a reservation before going because I waited a long time to get a table, but I liked how they had a very nice area for people waiting.  Pretty good feel in the restaurant, the only bad thing is I went during a dj night and it was SUPER loud.  I'm not a fan of having to speak loudly while eating.  I think that was the only downside.  Now to the good stuff.  The food was absolutely AMAZING!!!  I had ordered so much sushi that I can't even remember what all I ordered.  The only thing I can remember was that it was heaven in my mouth.  I could feel the angels just flying in there gracing me with goodness in there.  My favorite thing off the menu was the Kalbi appetizer.  It was so delicous that I was tempted to order more, but the sushi came out before I did and it was plentiful enough.  I would recommend this place, but just beware of the dj techno night because it was a tad bit too loud.

Ok, so I'm going to lay it out on the line for you. I've been to this place twice.   I visited the first time when I was in town to see my best friend. I lived in San Francisco at the time. For starters, the place looks amazing! It is very nice and left a nice impression on me for Charlotte. The pros: The sushi is ok, but not spectacular. It lacked on presentation for such a nicely decorated place and for the prices. We are paying for the experience, right? I can get the same thing from any fast food sushi place in the city (SF). Still, the atmosphere is pretty chic, and I was enjoying time with m y best friend... then it happened. I started to notice the paintings/ pictures all over the place: of the owner... ok, so a bit vane... then it happened! She grabbed a mic and started singing karaoke in the middle of the bar, trying to get the people to clap. People were going along with it too. I was like "wtf" is going on! Is this a circus? Am I about to see people swinging from the ceiling? No. She sang one poorly sung song and that was it. It was completely out of place. One word: major vanity.   Visit 2: The food was the same. We ordered sashimi and got nigiri: not a big deal, just leave the rice off.  The bill was way too high for 2 people. It was over $100 pre tip. This is way more than any sushi I have paid for in Northern California.   So my rating system for this one? One star b/c that's mandatory, one star for the ambience, one star because I'd probably go back simply for the atmosphere... and as long as I'm not sung to karaoke style.

I would give this place a 3.5. Nikko's is good but a bit overrated. Probably bc Charlotte doesn't have extensive options when it comes to Japanese restaurants. But the food is good, so I return for that reason. And the drinks were strong so that's a plus. They are a tad bit overpriced for the food but again that's because they can be. Nice ambiance and good for groups. Also have tv's so you can watch sporting events while there.

I went to Nikko this past weekend for a friend's birthday, after maybe three or four years since my last visit. We had reservations at 8:30 and were seated once our whole party arrived.  One we were seated the owner greeted us with a little singing and dancing, and a toast (even though we only had water at this time) to the birthday girl! It was great to see the owner has not lost her touch, still in her cowboy hat walking around, dancing and having fun with her customers.  After ordering our drinks, we started with a variety of appetizers, gyoza, dumplings, calamari, and some others that everyone seemed to enjoy.  As for entrees, everyone ordered a variety of sushi rolls and I got some the tuna roll and nigiri, which was a generous portion and very fresh fish.  I will say the rolls came in 6 pieces where typically you receive 8.  However, I was still full from what I ordered. The drinks were great and the service was on point, filling waters and cocktails and addressing any needs we needed.  We had a party of 10 and all were splitting our bills, yes, we were that group.  However, there were no issues  with the waiter and everyone's bills were on point. Overall, I was happy to see things haven't changed at Nikko and love the atmosphere, music and overall environment especially for a get together like a birthday or fun night out.
Food is good.  Service is absolutely terrible.  They care more about making it a club scene than focusing on good service.

My wife took me to Nikko a couple of years ago really nice atmosphere great sushi with good service. We  haven't went back so it's a little difficult to assess how good Nikko is. We plan to take another trip.
The food was amazing! The filet mignon and sushi was tasteful as well as their wide selection of sake.

Nikkos!   I really enjoyed this place on my first visit! The atmosphere is neat, and the owner is a ball of fun.  I started the night off with a cucumber martini, it was strong but good. Then a friend and I ordered some rolls. I got the Dragon Roll, and TNT roll. So yummy, I enjoyed my rolls very much and even had to sneak a grab of my friends!  Later we shared the ORIGINAL XANGOS CHEESECAKE (Rich, smooth cheesecake with a slightly tangy finish rolled in a melt-in-your-mouth, flaky pastry tortilla. Served with a side of ginger ice cream.)  Um, yum! I really enjoyed this dessert.  I will be back at Nikkos soon!  Check them out! http://www.nikkosushibar.net/

Stopped by during their quiet hours of Sunday late evening to take advantage of their discounted appetizer.  $6 for the discounted shrimp tempura and they are decent. Fresh, good service even though I was waiting in the front.  Asked a ton of questions and they don't seem to be annoyed with me.  Though the staff do gather at the end in the front and talk.   I watched golf in the flat screen TV in the bar while waiting for my to-go orders to come out.  The Lobster roll and calamari (which comes with a large plate of veggies underneath).  The Lobster roll was $25 (not too pricey in my book) and they are really tasty.  I spent the whole night, almost to consume the entire plate.  I will definitely be back and I am looking to meet the owner some time. Her photos are everywhere in kimono and they looked really nice.  I heard she has an unique character which makes their dishes even more interesting.   The immediate surrounding is not far from I-277 N and it is quiet with mostly residential grounds and not much other businesses to distract you from your quiet enjoyment of the outside scenery --which is mostly fast driving vehicle going by on a busy surface street.   Will definitely be back and hopefully this time is with a group in the back for a more comfortable dining experience.

This place moved so be careful when your routing here. A nice modern, upscale Japanese restaurant that is located near the city. You can tell this place is popular at night due to its location and stylish bar. Our waiter was nice and friendly and the seating was very spacious. The food they serve here ranges from traditional Japanese food to modern surf and turf rolls. We ared the Chirachi, calamari, cowboy roll and a California roll. Upon first glance the price may seem a bit on the pricer end. However when the food arrived we noticed they give you a lot for your money. The rolls were not small and you could tell the quality of ingredients used were fresh. The caliamari had a nice sweet and salty aioli sauce.  The chirachi had big cuts of sashimi. The california roll was fresh. The cowboy roll which I strongly recommend for $18 is a friend shrimp tempera roll topped off with thin slices of sashimi fish and smoked beef. Though Im usually not a fan of surf and turf, I have to say this roll worked out extremely well as it was well balanced. Overall this a nice place to go to anytime. What would make this place better is a better lunch special. If you come here and your not too hungry perhaps just get a drink and the cowboy roll. I promise you its very satifying. CHeers!

Really nice modern looking place with a magical atmosphere and amazing food. perfect for social gathering and late dinner as well.  the service was excellent and not to mention the sushi. definitely coming back!

The only reason why I am giving this establishment one star is because the system wont allow me to give 0 stars. I will never patronize this restaurant again. A group of maybe 15 of us went out to celebrate a friend's birthday. Our food was cold. At the end of the night, two of the people in my party were accused of receiving an entree without paying for it. The manager was extremely rude. He stated that he would to look at the security camera to see if they had in fact ordered another entree. The fact was, they never ordered 2 entrees. It was only 1. I am aware of this because I sat directly across from them and observed exactly what they had received. Again, they only received 1 entree. The manager on duty never apologized and proceeded to become belligerent with us. Needless to say, I will not be patronizing this restaurant anymore and I encourage you to do the same. I would prefer to patronize establishments that actually care about its customers. This one, does not!

I liked the vibe in this place. Very nice decor and a very friendly staff.   Now to the Sushi. I focused the wide variety of rolls and had no problem finding a couple of winners such as the Rainbow Roll, Salmon Crunchy Roll and Spider Roll. I also branched out to try the Cowboy Roll with Kobe Beef. It just did not mix well with Sushi. Pass on that one.  Overall a great dining experience. I highly recommend Nikko.

I wanted to love this place because it's in my backyard, but I have been here multiple times and never left feeling like it was a great experience.  Food, drink, and service is average...but the prices are above average...so they have that going for them I guess.  Around 8PM they turn on deafening club music on the weekend, so you may leave here feeling like you have tinnitus.

Underwhelming. Disappointing. Overpriced. Overrated.  Parking: Valet only or blocks away - every parking area/structure near the entrance is private parking.  Wait time: none, which was nice. But we had to ask for everything. For small plates, for the little soy sauce bowls, for water.... everything. Nothing was really anticipated of our needs.  Drinks: ordered 2 martinis - one gin & one vodka - we got 2 gin martinis. sent it back and received a smaller vodka portion than the gin martini which had been 3-4sips in  We didn't find one thing on the "specials menu" that sounded appetizing (mango was in more than half the dishes)... and even the basics for sushi did not seem all to great.  SUSHI: Edamame - delicious  Dragonfly roll (spicy tuna, crab/avocado & asparagus flaw fried & plated with spicy teriyaki sauce) and didn't find any tuna in any part of the roll  Godzilla roll (California Roll topped with Spicy Tuna & tempura chips) the spicy tuna on top was more like a minced tuna paste as if it was the soup part of the bottom of the bowl the was scrapped together.. very little tuna, way more paste/sauce  Best Tip about this place: meh... no wait time? it was a Saturday night at 7pm and only half the place was filled.

I'm trying to think of something negative to write about Nikko, but I just can't seem to spit it out. Everything that Murphy defined, can go wrong and has gone wrong here at Nikko. But I can easily forget, look right past it and drink my Asahi. Its like a love/hate relationship.   The allure of the restaurant is backed by modern design, mezmorizing lighting (blue or green backdrop behind the sushi bar) and not to mention exquisite bathrooms. They offer nice touches such as this gritty hand soap "that also massages your hands, without dehydrating them, leaving a hint of oil." Sushi is normally a premium, but prices are especially high here. They offer many signature "hollywood glam" rolls, that can be especially pricey and not fulfilling.
